item.title: [BW-11588] ADFS: Dignity Fixes to SSO workflow
item.description:
We did a first round of work on the Dignity Health ADFS SSO improvements in the following tickets which are going to prod.

This jira is to track any fixes or improvements to this functionality now that we have it in testing environments that will work with our AD and customer's AD.

Original Jiras:
BW-10728 Shipped
BW-10584 Shipped

Action Items:

Set up a proper dev environment with the right configuration to test and debug this.

  1. Don't set base url for clinical portal domain names. This causes testing/dev problems that only arise after the code is on stage/prod!
    1. Remove one-sites-dt.avizia.com as the domain from any specific clinical portals in enterprise config. #
  2. Need domain url (C names) that go directly to specific Dev portals.
    1. Set up 2 clinical portals on dev with distinct domain names.
    2. Dev Clinical Portal A: dev-dt1.avizia.com.
    3. Dev Clinical Portal B: dev-dt2.avizia.com
  3. DONE - Complete documentation of the new functionality in the SSO configuration doc: DYLAN
    1. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1irNXS6T7X6tNSgXU3sZzHRcadC4rtM-bluobTVglW6Y/edit#

Issues:

  1. Unauthorized users dropped into the wrong portal when redirected back to Avizia (default clinical portal as opposed to dh-stage1. Need to keep the redirect context.
  2. Simply not working. John and Dylan configured the stage to look exactly like stage as well as the example Claims Rules that Adam sent for Dignity Health.

Claims Rule Configuration In AD:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/identity/ad-fs/operations/create-a-rule-to-send-group-membership-as-a-claim
item.summary: ADFS: Dignity Fixes to SSO workflow

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment:
Dylan Marks I'm currently working on the issues mentioned in this ticket and need some clarification:

  1. What response should be sent out to mobile for unauthorized login attempt? Currently we are redirecting the user back to their clinical portal with the message on login screen on the web.
  2. We are parsing the claim rules from the SAML response from AD. John Grosjean Can you please set up the claim rules on Avizia ADFS so that I can debug on DT environment?

Might need help from the mobile team on the code flow for single sign on. If there is an error with the SSO (eg if we decide that person shouldn't be allowed in), how do we render that on the mobile app. Just show a web page? Or should we pass back an API/js object to the app to render in native? Alexey Marenych

Ibad Baig I cannot keep using our corporate ADFS for testing purposes. Please update v10 to use metadata link https://v10oneinternaltestv1.samlidp.io/saml2/idp/metadata.php, user "test1" pw "Testing1!". Provide me with the metadata link for dt, and I'll setup this side of it. Or you guys can signup at samlidp.io using a yopmail account and have full control.
Thanks.

Thanks John Grosjean I created an account on samlidp.io and configured a new IDP to use it with the clinical portal on DT environment and it worked fine.

Dylan Marks As per the issue # 2 in the description of the ticket, can you please provide me a SAML response from stage on Dignity Health environment where you set up the claim rules? So that I can see how the attributes are being passed in the response. I tried to reproduce this issue by configuring the claim rules on my newly created IDP on samlidp.io and as well as on our local 10pearls ADFS but it worked fine for me.

Dylan Marks For the Action Items (improvements) mentioned in the description above, please have a look at the following:

  1. The Domain field on the site settings page is used for redirection on the login page so that the user does not have to write clinical portal code when they access the site. The SSO workflow does not use this domain field, however, I checked it by setting the domain field empty against the site and verified that it has no affect on SSO workflow.
  2. I tried to open the URLs below but they don’t seem to exist:
    1. Dev Clinical Portal A: dev-dt1.avizia.com
    2. Dev Clinical Portal B: dev-dt2.avizia.com

Working on getting Honor Health set up with this on production as a second customer to test with. Updated the documentation for SSO here https://drive.google.com/open?id=1irNXS6T7X6tNSgXU3sZzHRcadC4rtM-bluobTVglW6Y

BW‌-11805

Re: Ibad’s comment above: I have not set up those urls. My point is that we need to rework our dev servers so that they act like stage servers. I’m advocating that our seed data for dev does not overload the dev url for the dev environment with the specific clinical portal URL. Not sure I explained that well. I think best bet is working with the dev ops team here. John Grosjean knows what I’m talking about better than I do and would be able to help you.

The goal with that change is to avoid what happened on stage a few weeks ago where SSO worked on dev, but then failed badly on stage and caused the release to be delayed since dev is configured in a ‘simpler’ way than stage environments that have many different clinical portals for different enterprises.

Ibad BaigDylan Marks I have made code changes so that any dev environment built by CircleCI will have DNS entries for both the base URLs (one-enterprise-

{branch}, one-patients-{branch}

, and one-sites-

{branch}) and custom URLs ({branch}

-ent,

{branch}-patients, and {branch}

-sites) that can be applied to any of the respective portals on that env. This will allow testing a custom URL for SSO or any other ticket.

Dylan Marks The issue occurred few weeks ago on stage was due to the missing session object in BW‌-10584 code changes which was present in the prod branch. It worked on dev environment though as the base URL for redirect (assert) is the same as base URL for dev. The changes above made by John have been deployed on dt environment and I’ve verified that SSO workflow is working as expected.

Summarizing the work left in this ticket:

  1. Need to confirm the response from mobile team for unauthorized login attempt.
  2. Need SAML response from stage so that I can debug how the claim rules are being sent.
  3. Need to setup SSO on dev-dt1.avizia.com and dev-dt2.avizia.com. The URLs are not currently set up.

Let me know if there's something I need to do here. I'm waiting for this to be solid before we go back to Dignity. Honor also wants to make use of this new AD Group functionality.

We are struggling with being able ot see what is sent from the AD for two reasons: 1. can only capture it in a browser that has a SAML logger installed (such as mine with SAML Message Decoder extension). 2. The assertions are sent encrypted and thus not easy to view.

For that reason I don't have a way to get example assertions to you. We need some sort of logger for that.
Ibad Baig

Dylan Marks I was able to get the SAML response on stage (dh-stage1.avizia.com) from SAML Message Decoder browser extension and it looks like it was not able to parse some of the claim rules as it matched the exact same name (upper and lower cases in the keys). I’ve done some improvements in it to cater these issues and it’s currently in our QA.

The site dh-stage1 is currently configured to use Avizia Active Directory (saml) as ADFS. The test user has the following credentials:

UN: test2sso

PW: SAMLuser2

It’s important to log these API requests and responses specially in case of external services. The info logs didn’t work previously, need to have a look at it.

To confirm, you are going to start logging the SAML assertions that come in? That would definitely help us with support issues.

We just need to make sure that isn't a security concern and these assertions couldn't be replayed to log in as someone else. I don't think they would be.

Yes. The SSO API calls are already being logged in logs_login table in our database. However, I saw that in the code it’s not logging the /assert API request as it expected req.enterprise to exist in the request object which doesn’t in case of /assert request done by ADFS. I have made some changes in activityLogs file to handle this particular case because we already have the RelayState parameter in /assert request containing the enterprise ID which can be used to populate the enterprise.

We are experiencing some support issues with ADFS right now and your work here my help.

Faisal Islam is looking into this. Will this ticket help us with debugging ADFS problems in the future. Will we be able to see the SAML that comes across from random users logging in to help track down issues?

It would be helpful for our logging to actually save the unencrypted SAML from the SSO into the logs_login table so we can use that for debugging issues. Please add that. We may actually want to hotfix a small release with this change in the next day or two if at all possible to help with a production SSO issue. Thoughts on that Ibad Baig Ajay Kumar

Faisal Islam

Dylan Marks The SAML response from AD which I have logged can be decoded via online third-party tools like https://www.samltool.com/base64.php, however, I’m going to make use of other columns in logs_login table to save the decrypted SAML response along with other attributes like SAML context and RelayState for easier debugging.
Ibad Baig Asad Zubair - Can we separate out the saving of the unencrypted SAML from SSO into logs_login, into a separate branch? We would like to get this out to production as a hotfix.
Faisal IslamYes it can be done separately. Should I create a new branch from prod and do the logging in it?
Ibad Baig yes. Please create a new branch from prod. We will provide you with a hotfix branch to create the PR against on Monday.
We are trying to set up Honor Health with the same group mapping and this logging would help with a call tomorrow. Any chance this is going into the hotfix today? Faisal Islam

Asad Zubair could we review why users are not getting first + last name set as part of the SSO? What attributes should the RP be sending so that this is properly set. I’ve not had any success with name getting set for a user and it is causing other issues when user’s with NULL names are in the system.

Either we address under this issue as a subtask, or please create a new Jira to track this.

Ibad Baig could you give a summary of the changes actually done on this ticket and what the next steps are for testing? What do we need from Dignity Health. This ticket is critical for migration and implementation team isn’t sure what next steps should be once this is released.

Faisal Islam was wondering if that hotfix to track SSO logging went to prod already.
https://bitbucket.org/avizia/one/pull-requests/10949/bw-11588-logs-master/diff

It would be great if it did as we want DH to do an SSO click through and look at the format of the data they are sending us in case we need to make any additional changes on this ticket.
I have added a separate Jira to track the fact that first + last name is not getting set: https://emergemd.jira.com/browse/BW-12175

Dylan Marks Following is the summary of what we have done in this ticket:

  1. Added logging for SSO api calls in logs_login table to log SAML Requests and RelayState in decrypted form to help with debugging. (Verified on DT)
  2. Improved parsing of claim rules. It’s been made case-insensitive so we don’t have to worry about the case sensitivity while adding the claim rules on AD. For e.g. it should be able to parse the firstname irrespective of lower and upper cases in firstname property (claim rule name) ‌coming in from AD. (John needs to set up firstname, lastname claims on AD)
  3. Unauthorized users will land on their respective web portals on login page instead of one-sites-*.avizia.com (Verified on DT)

What has not been achieved:

  1. Set up SSO on the following URLs, both of them do not exist (John needs to set up these urls):
    1. Dev Clinical Portal A: dev-dt1.avizia.com (John needs to configure this domain)
    2. Dev Clinical Portal B: dev-dt2.avizia.com (John needs to configure this domain)
  2. We are not sure what response should be sent to mobile for unauthorized user login. (Point # 3 above has been achieved on the web portal.) (Need response from mobile team TPC)

I do think that I’ve already covered BW‌-12175 with the point # 2 from the achievement list above. It will be great if John can add FirstName and LastName claim rules in Avizia AD for the test users he provided, so we can have it tested on DT environment.

Also I think it will be very useful if we can have this ticket pushed to stage (currently it is in testing on DT environment) so that we can test this functionality on DH stage.

Note: No work done in this ticket has been pushed to any environment other than DT.

John Grosjean Alexey Marenych Ajay Kumar Faisal Islam Asad Zubair

Thanks for the detail updates. These are some important fixes. Please reach out directly to those you are waiting on if you don't get a response soon.

Do you know if that SSO logging code got pushed to production earlier? I was hoping we could have a couple customers do a click through on prod and capture what the assertion actually looks like for DH and Honor with group membership passed. We are working blind without that. Otherwise we need to get this story to prod, capture the logs and then run a different Jira for addressing any mismatch between expectation and reality of the SAML structure.

Sure I will reach out.

I have the PR ready for stage and production which contains only the logging part done in this ticket. I suggested Faisal to push the logging work to stage first but I don't think it's pushed to stage or production.

item.title: [BW-11304] AXA - Dependent Information Not Coming Through to Patient Portal
item.description:
Description

1. Visa benefits portal user logs into visa benefits portal
2. Then they select dependent
3. Then they enter dependent demographics
4. Then select visa credit to submit
5. Takes them to avizia patient portal where dependent demo should have been passed over
6. Demo was not passed over and country and city drop down is not clickable.

Visa Benefits Portal - https://visabenefitslac.axa-assistance.us/
Visa Patient Portal - visa.avizia.com

* Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.
item.summary: AXA - Dependent Information Not Coming Through to Patient Portal

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment: ayman@avizia.com Dylan asked me to assign this to Asad and tag you as this is currently affecting AXA's ability to check in dependents
Got it. Thank u
Original JIRA for this work https://emergemd.jira.com/browse/BW-8845

Philip Lee Asad Zubair ayman@avizia.com We diagnosed the above issue and found that the checkIsPatientMinor(...) method is expecting country field from the input which is either null or undefined causing the process to break. Following is the error detail found on logentries:

"err_message":"Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of null","err_stack":"TypeError: Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of null\n at module.exports.checkIsPatientMinor (/srv/one/lib/entity/patients/index.js:1032:39)\n at promise.all.then.response (/srv/one/patients/shared/patient/index.js:49:49)\n at tryCatcher (/srv/one/node_modules/bluebird/js/release/util.js:16:23)\n

The work on this feature is recently done by Rajesh in this commit:
https://bitbucket.org/avizia/one/commits/0be56cac84cf6ea316efbc1c445821b957212c17#chg-lib/entity/patients/index.js

Should AXA send us the country information in the response for this dependent patient workflow?
If yes, we need to make sure it is being sent.
If not, I assume we need to handle it internally.

Rajesh Poddaturi, Can you please have a look at this?

Ibad Baig Philip Lee Asad Zubair ayman@avizia.com we need to handle this internally.
below are the changes we need. The code has been updated from if (!input.date_of_birth) to if (!input.date_of_birth || !input.country)
lib/entity/patients/index.js

checkIsPatientMinor(input) {
        let isPatientMinor = false;

        if (!input.date_of_birth || !input.country) {
            isPatientMinor = true;
            return promise.resolve({
                isPatientMinor: isPatientMinor
            });
        }
       
        .
        .
        .
}

I test the code using api functionality. I don't have a sso setup to test this . could you guys please test this with the sso settings.

I agree on fixing the logic. At the same time, I think it is strange they aren't sendig the country. Since these patients are in Brazil (from my understanding) they are going to need to explicitly tell us that so it doesn't incorrectly default to United States. Philip Lee can you push back on the ticket with that piece of information?

Fixing this logic is important regardless though. Thanks Rajesh and Ibad.

Rajesh Poddaturi Can you please confirm where it is deployed? Philip Lee Can you please guide us how to test this issue?

FYI Asad Zubair Ibad Baig

Ajay Kumar this has not been deployed any where. In previous comments i added the code changes needed. I was not sure which environment has axa SSO setup to test it.
Taught If some one from 10p has idea about the axa setup or have an environment with setup could test the changes for me.

Asad Zubair Ibad Baig Philip Lee

Thanks Rajesh Poddaturi. We will add your code in BW-11304 DEV QA branch and deploy it on our dt environment for testing. AXA is configured on dt environment. Philip Lee can you please provide test credentials for AXA (https://americas-uat-axa.omegabit.com/web/visa-main-portal/login-sso.html) also please guide us how to add dependent information.

FYI Asad Zubair Ibad Baig

Ajay Kumar Rajesh Poddaturi Thanks guys. Also, can we make sure we take Dylan Marks 's suggestion on country? AXA is saying the dependent should use the parent's address. Can we verify that this is the API that we're hitting for the dependent information? https://rest.axa-assistance.com/private/visagateway/WebportalApigetDependentInformation

Here is a sample response from that API below: 

 {
        "Relationship": "Son",
        "Last_Name": "zz",
        "Gender": "Male",
        "First_Name": "xxyy",
        "Email": "1test@capgemini.com",
        "Dependent_Id": "f02d4c4d-612c-415f-b5a3-2a30ba1f97eb-001",
        "Date_of_Birth": "1988-03-16",
        "Customer_Id": "f02d4c4d-612c-415f-b5a3-2a30ba1f97eb"
    },

Here is the API for just the customer's info: https://rest.axa-assistance.com/private/visagateway/WebportalApigetCHInformation

Rajesh Poddaturi Your suggested changes have been deployed on DT environment (https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com).

Philip Lee I've verified in the code that we're using https://rest.axa-assistance.com/private/visagateway/WebportalApigetDependentInformation API for populating dependent info and https://rest.axa-assistance.com/private/visagateway/WebportalApigetCHInformation API for patient's info. Please provide the test credentials for https://americas-uat-axa.omegabit.com/web/visa-main-portal so that we can verify the dependent patient workflow with this fix on DT environment.

FYI Asad Zubair Ajay Kumar

Ibad Baig Here are the test creds:

Username: cpompa1030@yopmail.com

PW: CpMain2324!

Please test and let me know if everything looks good. Thanks!

Philip Lee I am unable to login with the credentials provided above. It's giving this error message:
The operation could not be completed.

Please see the screenshot for details.

Philip Lee We are able to login on visa portal (https://americas-uat-axa.omegabit.com/web/visa-main-portal) using test creds provided above but didn't find any option to add dependent info. Also, when I am trying to login via Visa Login button on https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com/ it redirects me to dashboard of patient portal. Can you help us in adding dependent info so that we can test it.

FYI Ibad Baig Asad Zubair

Thanks, Ajay Kumar. Please take a look at my video below showing how to submit visit as dependent. Also, after you complete the form as dependent, it should redirect you to the avizia patient portal, but it doesnt seem to be doing that.

axaUATdemo.mov
Ajay Kumar can i get an update on this please? Thanks!

Philip Lee Looks like redirection URL is not configured properly on Visa UAT site (https://americas-uat-axa.omegabit.com/web/visa-main-portal). Once user adds the dependent information and clicks on Access button, it should redirect user to patient portal https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com (Similar to what is happening on Production site). Then we can verify our fix.

FYI Ibad Baig Asad Zubair
The redirect to the correct environment now. Please see if it works now. Thanks!

Ajay Kumar the redirect to https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com is in place now, however, when you submit from https://americas-uat-axa.omegabit.com/web/visa-main-portal it does NOT log you in on the patient portal.
Philip Lee We are looking into the login flow that it should be logged in automatically, looks like a configuration issue.
Ibad Baig Ok, please let me know. The customer would like an update. Thanks!

Philip Lee There is a url redirection issue that AXA needs to configure to log in to our patient portal automatically. Please have them configure the following url:

https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com/oauth/verify/AXA_PROVIDER

I tried to manually log in to our portal with the dependent patient and it worked fine. Is there any specific AXA user that has dependent information which does not work on our portal? I tested the following user on https://americas-uat-axa.omegabit.com/web/visa-main-portal

UN: jho333@yopmail.com
PW: Hoje@2017

Also I noticed that if the state in the dependent information does not match with the state drop list on our patient portal it shows empty. Is this the expected behavior?

Thanks! Ibad Baig

I was under the impression that dependent state should be the same as the cardholder’s state.

Philip Lee Any update regarding URL redirection configuration? We are expecting redirection at https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com/oauth/verify/AXA_PROVIDER once dependent is added. Once this is configured user will auto login on patient portal. We can only verify the fix and state issue once user is able to login automatically
Ajay Kumar the redirect has been configured but it is throwing this error page.
Ajay Kumar Ibad Baig Can I please get an update on this? Customer is requesting to know when this will be fixed. Thanks!

Philip Lee It looks like AXA has not configured the callback URL correctly, because the route https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com/oauth/verify/AXA_PROVIDER does not hit when I click on Access button after adding dependent information, it takes me directly to the following URL:

https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com/?language=pt_BR&patient=1&id=MzViMjlmM2MtZmFkYy00NTI1LWIzYTctZDVkMTZkZWViMjE4LTAwMQ==

This route should be configured as callback URL when we click on Access button https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com/oauth/verify/AXA_PROVIDER.
Ibad Baig Thanks for the update. I've let axa know.
Ibad Baig The callback url has been set to https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com/oauth/verify/AXA_PROVIDER     , please let me know if you can test now. Thanks!

Philip Lee Thanks for the updates. Now we are getting CPF/CNPJ error (screenshot attached) when user is adding dependent information on https://americas-uat-axa.omegabit.com/ using below credentials

Username: cpompa1030@yopmail.com
PW: CpMain2324!

I believe previously such field was not required. Please share the CPF code for Physical person or CNPJ code for Legal person for above user.

FYI Ibad Baig Asad Zubair

Ajay Kumar Please use this CPF for testing: 62591873356

I believe the issue is with some modifications has been done because a new request from Visa and it’s not being taken into account the connection with Avizia with the API.

Please see attached the Updated API for dependent.

item.title: [BW-10660] Epic SSO: New users not receiving default roles and groups on clinical portal
item.description:
As a fairview administrator, I'm trying to setup the proper permissions so when someone clicks through from Epic they land on their existing user account or get a new account generated with the configured default permissions.

  1. Default permissions not getting set for a new user added to a clinical portal.
    1. Need to set the proper permissions based on Enterprise>Clinical Portals>Roles and Groups. This page should really be called 'Default Roles and Groups'. What is set here is what should be added by default to any new users coming in. That way, we can defer to the settings in the identity provider (in this case Epic) and generate a provider on the fly if they come in for the first time.
item.summary: Epic SSO: New users not receiving default roles and groups on clinical portal

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

Also need to confirm we set default roles and groups when we create a user from the HL7 interface as well.

Fairview and Parkland have issues with the Avizia Link not working when selecting on Epic Context Aware link. The patients had to clear the cache 3 times in order for IE to work and be logged into the case that was created from Epic. Chrome seems to be working, but they would like the Context Aware link to work consistently on IE.

item.title: [BW-10634] Fairview: Epic Context Linking with multiple Epic instances
item.description:
As a customer admin, I have multiple Epic EMRs that I need to support Epic context linking with (both a referring spoke and a hub instance). Context linking needs to be smart enough to handle that.

Support for multiple Epic instances in one enterprise by configuring the context link to receive the EMR GatewayIntegrationID.

BACKGROUND DISCUSSION:
I tested Epic Context linking in four different environments. Stage and production a variety of error messages without any additional details to understand what went wrong. This is using the default test json without any modifications.

  • Test with MUSC Demo and see if there's another issue happening.
  • Below requirements need to be addressed

Summary of Issues found during configuration:

  1. Hard coded 'Pending' workflow status or it silently fails. Pretty much all production workflows default to the status 'Waiting Room' instead.
    1. Perhaps one option for now is to also look for 'Waiting Room' status if Pending is not found. Throw a clear error message if neither workflow status is found.
  2. No support for multiple EMRs. We need to support multiple Epic EMRs on one site. I think that means we should be optionally taking the EMR GUID in the query string format variable list so that we can use that to find the right context. It will probably help increase security as well.
    1. To support multiple EMRs, we could change our cryptstr format to include the emr GatewayID in the querystring:
      https://your-address.avizia.com/SSO/Epic/?emrID=d308d098-d563-4bb8-93c8-96e61261af61&data=&CRYPTSTR*
    2. EMRID = GatewayIntegrationID in the medical record settings.
    3. It should then look at GatewayIntegrationID and compare it with the portal (your-address) to make sure a match. If emrID is not passed, find the first Epic EMR type and use that. This should work even if it is not an Epic EMR - we may start using context aware linking for non-Epic integrations (such as Cerner mPages).
  3. Better error message when the encryption key is wrong rather than a generic 400 error.
  4. If a Clinical Module is not linked to a Program it fails silently. Should be an explicit error message somewhere - at least in log entries - for this.
  5. Dev sites have seed data which is much different than production configurations. That means things work well on dev sites and we have all sorts of surprises on production that are hard to trace or debug.
  6. Data mapping editor now works, but it doesn't seem to be working to select the right clinical module: BW‌-10664

Tracking in separate tickets:

  1. Permissions - Related issues I'm tracking to this:
    1. Need a better error message when no permissions: BW‌-10659
    2. Not picking up default permissions and can't edit externaluserid: BW‌-10660
item.summary: Fairview: Epic Context Linking with multiple Epic instances

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment:
ayman@avizia.com Asad Zubair Zaheer Ahmed I can't seem to get Epic Context Aware linking to work at all on prod or stage sites. It works for me on devtp02 though.

Fairview was planning to go live with a new context aware linking use case on Monday and so this is needs to be a critical fix, ideally part of the hotfix on monday. I'm not sure why it is happening though.

1. Issue 1 - Only reproduced when multiple EMRs created (Epic type). This is when the 400 error happens.
    1. This was a problem on Fairview. I changed the other test EMR to another type to avoid this. This needs to be fixed with a new jira
  2. Other possible causes: if Case States are not configured exactly right in Workflow.
    1. For example we are expecting a 'Pending' case state for this to work. The word 'Pending' is hard coded as the case state for generating this.
  3. Priority is undefined in cases generated from SSO. This should not be a required field on a case, but for now we should just set the priority by default to 'Routine'.
  4. Other properties may be required on cases now with changes to case details page such as VPG and case details v2. This page is now failing when generated from Epic SSO which may not set all the properties in the exact same way. We should make sure that the case details page loads with minimal case attributes set to avoid this scenario. Priority is one, but what other attributes does the page choke on if not set. We can look at the example case I created to see what else is missing in the database.

I clicked through with implementation site and know that Case 251 was generated as I got the notification for DylanTest777 on my mobile app which is logged into that production site. However, unable to open this case.
https://implementation.avizia.com/#/case-detail/75aae579-fd38-4e4f-81a5-630e0f88d351/a997bd51-b7a0-48e2-b61d-187946631e6a

I think we need to start building out better seed data for dev sites. 10p is working on databases that are pretty far off from what things look like on prod and struggle to reproduce or build based on production-realistic configurations.

Dylan Marks
We tried creating an internal case using clinical module Epic video Consults on the implementation site, but it still gave the same error message, which means that the issue is not specific to Epic Context link. We tried with Behavioral Health workflow, and it worked fine. We are looking into any differences between the two workflows, and would update as soon as we find them.

The issue with the Epic Video Consults workflow was that it was not added to any Program. Once I added it to the Inpatient program, it started working both through Epic SSO, and internally.
Dylan Marks Suhail Khaled Asad Zubair

I confirmed that implementation site is working now.

When I check Fairview Prod, both of the clinical modules are associated with a Program, so the issue is different there. Perhaps there we are dealing with the Priority not being set?

Dylan Marks Aleeza Hassan

Related issues I'm tracking to this:
BW-10659 Ready to Push
BW-10660 Code Review

I think there are many overlapping issues I'm trying to separate out that are causing problems with Epic SSO. I'm going to focus this bug on making sure that the configuration is not so brittle and that we have proper error feedback if it runs into an issue with some part of the configuration.

Issues I need to split out into separate tickets:

  1. Hard coded 'Pending' workflow status or it silently fails. Pretty much all production workflows default to the status 'Waiting Room' instead.
  2. No support for multiple EMRs. We need to support multiple Epic EMRs on one site. I think that means we should be optionally taking the EMR GUID in the query string format variable list so that we can use that to find the right context. It will probably help increase security as well.
  3. Better error message when the encryption key is wrong rather than a generic 400 error.
  4. Is there actually a bug to do with not handling default email settings?
  5. Permissions - Related issues I'm tracking to this:
    1. Need a better error message when no permissions: BW-10659 Ready to Push
    2. Not picking up default permissions and can't edit externaluserid: BW-10660 Code Review
  6. If a Clinical Module is not linked to a Program it fails silently. Should be an explicit error message somewhere - at least in log entries - for this.
  7. Dev sites have seed data which is much different than production configurations. That means things work well on dev sites and we have all sorts of surprises on production that are hard to trace or debug.
  8. Data mapping editor now works, but it doesn't seem to be working to select the right clinical module: BW-10664 Shipped

That's a lot of overlapping problems to work through!
ayman@avizia.com Asad Zubair

To support multiple EMRs, we could change our cryptstr format to include the emr GatewayID in the querystring:
https://your-address.avizia.com/SSO/Epic/?emrID=d308d098-d563-4bb8-93c8-96e61261af61&data=&CRYPTSTR*

It should then look at emrID and compare it with the portal (your-address) to make sure a match. If emrID is not passed, find the first Epic EMR type and use that. This should work even if it is not an Epic EMR - we may start using context aware linking for non-Epic integrations (such as Cerner mPages).
Updated the description with the work that needs to be done. I've dropped priority out of production issue level as I think we have a short term workaround for Fairview.

I'm unable to get MUSC Demo working now. I've checked all the issues I ran into with Fairview and addressed all of them using our workarounds. Still shows an 'Error occurred while processing your request'

I tested and configured some more on the Scheduled Visits workflow on MUSC-demo and I get an error even if I create a case for that clinical module directly in the site. So this is separate from the Epic SSO issues.

One thing to watch for regarding issue #2 - multiple EMRs. Let's not require the EMR ID. Aka maintain backwards compatibiltity - if there is no EMRID based in the context link query string, then we find the first Epic EMR as we currently do on production. I don't want to have to re-implement any customers already on prod.

Multiple Epic EMRs support has been implemented in this ticket while maintaining backward compatibility i.e. if there is no EMR ID attached in the context link query string, the first EMR would be selected of type Epic.
This has been tested in devtp02 environment.

Can you confirm where you find the EMRID to add to the cryptstr?

Is it in the url like I'm pointing to in this screenshot? Or is it the GatewayIntegrationID? Should we accept both to ensure there isn't confusion?

item.title: [BW-11586] Gateway Admin: Implement sorting on all list UIs
item.description:
Sorting should be added on all Gateway UIs to provide easier UX.

Default sortings should be as follows:

Webhook events: By ID.
webhook subscriptions: By datetime, oldest first.
Endpoints: By datetime, oldest first.
Redox subscriptions: By datetime, oldest first.
Customer: Alphabetical, A-Z.
Susbcriptions: By datetime, oldest first.
item.summary: Gateway Admin: Implement sorting on all list UIs

comments.comment:
Aleeza Hassan please specify to what kind of sorting type should be implemented to each columns ?
Basic to start off with be the “by Alphabetical Order“ ?
Rahil Khurshid Ali I have updated the ticket description with default sorting for each UI.

item.title: [BW-11934] Gateway: Add Case Number and Site Name to webhook error log
item.description:
As an admin, I would like to be able to identify the Site and Case for which the case complete interface failed to send the required transmission to an EMR

Requirements

  1. Add Case ID and Site Name to the webhook case complete error log.
  2. The goal here is that people viewing the error logs on _#flamingo-errors should be able to copy the Site Name and Case ID from the error log and then access the case from the relevant site that failed to send this transmission.

Current sample of webhook error log (which does not contain this info)
Alert Fired! Flamingo Errors - Production on Blackwell App, Err, Node Logs/Prod

<14>1 2018-10-06T02:39:45.444341Z one-prod-ip-10-0-11-142 one-sites-err - - - {"name":"sites","hostname":"one-prod-ip-10-0-11-142","pid":32458,"level":50,"message":"Messages failed to enqueue","success":false,"data":{"error":{},"topic":"BLACKWELL_HOOK","subscriber":{"id":"be3888e3-0970-47cc-bc34-41446dc87f35","name":"Epic Interface case complete","endpoint":"[https://gateway-listener-prod.avizia.com/webhook","data":"{\"headers\":

{\"verification-token\":\"9cd7bd79-4a11-428c-b0fa-48b6e355106b\"}

,\"basicAuth\":{}|https://gateway-listener-prod.avizia.com/webhook","data":"{\"headers\":

{\"verification-token\":\"9cd7bd79-4a11-428c-b0fa-48b6e355106b\"}

,\"basicAuth\":{}]}","event":"case_complete","created_at":"1536929994616","updated_at":"1536929994616"},"identifier":"92315439-46a1-4f1b-8b0e-dd32760d54b5","externalSystemId":"9a81ec3c-a78e-4646-b932-8b7ac654b38a","event":"case_complete"},"msg":"","time":"2018-10-06T02:39:45.276Z","v":0}
item.summary: Gateway: Add Case Number and Site Name to webhook error log

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment: Dylan Marks fyi we believe that adding these pieces of information to error logs would make them more useful. Let me know if you agree or if we need to add something else as well.
I think having enterprise name and site name would be valuable in logs everywhere that context exists. This will certainly help with escalations. Thanks.

We’ve added case number, site url and enterprise code along with full stack trace to the webhook error logs. A sample log would look like this now:

{

item.title: [BW-11107] Integration: Create a case from the Redox PatientAdmin.VisitUpdate
item.description: I would like to receive an ADT message (PatientAdmin.VisitUpdate) and have that create a case. This should only be for certain customers (Wellstar, not Northwell).
item.summary: Integration: Create a case from the Redox PatientAdmin.VisitUpdate

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment:
From: Andy Lebovsky <andy.lebovsky@redoxengine.com>
Date: Wednesday, August 8, 2018 at 10:15 AM
To: Dylan Marks <dylan.marks@AmericanWell.com>, Josh Napravnik <josh@redoxengine.com>, Aaron Harris <aaron.harris@AmericanWell.com>
Cc: "aleeza.hassan@tenpearls.com" <aleeza.hassan@tenpearls.com>
Subject: Re: Wellstar VisitUpdate

Will you run into the same issue if I do it similarly where the request will be different than the dashboard (if it’s an order)?

*You’ll also likely receive the same order multiple times for all the A08 messages they generate (as I’d have to use the VisitNumber as the OrderID when I pass it along to you) -

Thanks,
Andy

From: Andrew Lebovsky <andy.lebovsky@redoxengine.com>
Date: Wednesday, August 8, 2018 at 11:47 AM
To: Dylan Marks <dylan.marks@AmericanWell.com>, Josh Napravnik <josh@redoxengine.com>, Aaron Harris <aaron.harris@AmericanWell.com>
Cc: "aleeza.hassan@tenpearls.com" <aleeza.hassan@tenpearls.com>
Subject: Re: Wellstar VisitUpdate

Hi Dylan,

I’d need them to split the ADT feed and send the feed to me twice on separate ports, then I can control the data that data on the source.
Let me see what I can do to turn it into an Order message.

Thanks,
Andy

From: Dylan Marks <dylan.marks@AmericanWell.com>
Date: Wednesday, August 8, 2018 at 11:39 AM
To: Andy Lebovsky <andy.lebovsky@redoxengine.com>, Josh Napravnik <josh@redoxengine.com>, Aaron Harris <aaron.harris@AmericanWell.com>
Cc: "aleeza.hassan@tenpearls.com" <aleeza.hassan@tenpearls.com>
Subject: Re: Wellstar VisitUpdate

To clarify my question: is it possible for this to actually say ‘Appointment’ as opposed to VisitUpdate. Our Gateway requires dev if it continues to say VisitUpdate (even if the actual JSON is appt data).

Dylan Marks | Senior Manager, Product Interoperability
American Well | Vancouver, BC
Mobile: 403.471.0906 | www.americanwell.com

From: Dylan Marks <dylan.marks@AmericanWell.com>
Date: Wednesday, August 8, 2018 at 6:40 AM
To: Andy Lebovsky <andy.lebovsky@redoxengine.com>, Josh Napravnik <josh@redoxengine.com>, Aaron Harris <aaron.harris@AmericanWell.com>
Cc: "aleeza.hassan@tenpearls.com" <aleeza.hassan@tenpearls.com>
Subject: Wellstar VisitUpdate

It sounds like we need to do new development to support the PatientAdmin.VisitUpdate. We were hoping to avoid that by having Redox convert the ADT VisitUpdate into an arrived appointment before sending to us, so we wouldn’t have to do new development. Sounds like the way our integration engine works, it is not flexible enough to accept a scheduling message in the VisitUpdate.

1. If we have to support VisitUpdate this requires new development even if you are reworking the json to look like an appointment. This would likely not be available until the Aug 23 release. BW-11107 DEV QA
2. Send it as an Order message. Tomorrow’s prod release will support receiving Order messages to create a case. This was the original dev I’d queued up for Wellstar before they changed to using an ADT for this.
3. Redox convert the ADT incoming to an actual Scheduling message showing in the Redox logs (as opposed to it still displaying as a VisitUpdate).

Any chance Redox could solve this with option 2 or 3 in the short term?
Duration is null sometimes. Status is coming in outside of the VisitUpdate. I have asked Andy to make the change on Slack.
Since Redox is remapping these VisitUpdates to Arrived Appts instead, this particular story isn't as high priority. We can revisit in a bit.

item.title: [BW-10839] Integration: EHR Order Message case data mapping in EMR
item.description:
UMass uses the EHR Order Message in Epic to trigger off a case. We have not supported case data mapping on these order messages (setting facility and clinical module). This story will add that support for them.

  1. Three different data mappers:
    1. Cases
    2. Appointments
    3. Context Links <-- this should be the existing 'Cases' to support backwards compatibility.
  2. We previously discussed merging cases and appointments but the incoming attributes are different for each.
  3. Object Object appears in place of Input attributes for existing EMRs on Enterprise.
item.summary: Integration: EHR Order Message case data mapping in EMR

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment: FYI Calista Johnson on a ticket to support Order messages from Epic to properly create the case. Shooting for the Sept 13 release.
This ticket was pulled out from the previous release and now is a part of this release. Casey Stein can you please approve its PR? Thanks.
Verified on staging.
Verified on pre-prod.

item.description:

Demographics data (first name/last name/DOB/gender)

Dylan Marks - Please add any additional context.
item.summary: MUSC: Epic Integration - Need to send demographics in Appt check in

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment: Please prioritize ASAP. This is the highest priority for MUSC Epic. Should be a quick fix. Aleeza Hassan

Dylan Marks
Noted. Minhaj Uddin Khan would start working on it from Monday. This would require changes in the GET Appointment FHIR API so that it returns patient demographic data as well instead of just the patient identifier.
Minhaj Uddin Khan Aleeza Hassan - Can you please provide an update on this ticket? This is high priority for the client. Thank you.
Let’s try to get this into the Sept 6 release if at all possible.

This ticket is in Ready to Push state now along with its Gateway counterpart ticket BW‌-11311. We would need a Target Ship Date for both of them to send them in the Sept 6th release. Here is a sample Redox transmission that is being sent for appointment check-in now.

https://dashboard.redoxengine.com/#/dashboard/organization/1421/source/f534f5ac-59c3-4564-b52c-6181d2613c57/message/message/526016547

Dylan Marks
Lauren Kokernak this will allow us to send an appt checkin from v10 to Epic.
I have moved this to the Sep 13 release after discussing with ayman@avizia.com since its too late to accommodate for the Sep 6 release.
Asad Zubair ayman@avizia.com Just FYI…we MUST release this on 9/13 or MUSC will not have resources to work on this until late Q4 / early Q1. thank you!

Let’s make sure we test this on a stage site once this is available there (find a customer site with Appt check in enabled, do a check in workflow, and ensure that the demographics are sent in the Redox logs).

ayman@avizia.com Julie Henderson this got pushed out from this week which is going to derail MUSC. They have integration engineers that have to roll off this project if this release is delayed. It’s been in ready to push for two weeks and I consider it low impact.

Any chance this could get pulled into the hotfix this week?

The hotfix is already underway and is scheduled for today. We can’t just squeeze this last minute. What we can do is delay the hotfix till Monday, and include this part of hotfix. We need to get on a call with Dylan, Julie, Kevin, and Genny to make that determination.

ayman@avizia.com Per our convo today, we might need to break this out of the release. MUSC’s technical resources are leaving the project on 10/1. We really need to have this pushed on 9/27.

We can chat more tomorrow.

Kevin Eckhart ayman@avizia.com If we are planning to move out this ticket from the release then we would have to move out BW‌-11311 as well, since it contains the Gateway changes required to make this ticket work.
Verified on staging.
I have verified this on pre-prod through the GET Appointment details API. The end to end flow still needs to be verified after Gateway’s pre-prod deployment for ticket BW‌-11311.

item.title: [BW-11766] VisitNumber should be null in Media messages on Redox for RTF and PDF
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create webhook capability in Enterprise for any EMR to receive internal cases data.
  2. Create an internal case in Avizia.
  3. Complete it, while making sure that webhook was triggered when the case was completed.
  4. Go to Redox and open the Media message (RTF, PDF or both) for the respective case.

Expected:

Visit.VisitNumber should be sent as null to Redox when case is created internally.

Actual:

Internal case GUID is sent to Redox.

https://dashboard.redoxengine.com/#/dashboard/organization/1421/source/f534f5ac-59c3-4564-b52c-6181d2613c57/message/message/574627235
item.summary: VisitNumber should be null in Media messages on Redox for RTF and PDF

item.title: [BW-10076] Add option to remove/deactivate forms (case form / patient form ) in workflow
item.description:
As a user, there should be option to remove case form / patient form in workflow

This ticket is derived from BW-10021 Cancelled / BW-8221 Cancelled

This change will resolve BW-8221 Cancelled and BW-10021 Cancelled
item.summary: Add option to remove/deactivate forms (case form / patient form ) in workflow

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment:
Dylan Marks

We are going to implement a remove functionality for the following workflow forms on enterprise:

1. Case Forms
2. Patient Forms
3. CA200 Forms

As per the current behavior, the case detail page on sites will no longer display the form (which was filled by the user) if it has been removed from the workflow forms on enterprise. The record still exists on the database though, and it will be displayed if the workflow form is added back from the enterprise. So in this case, do we need to display the form on case detail if it is removed from the workflow forms on enterprise?

Ideally, when you remove a form it doesn't hide that form for old cases that have been filled out. We should avoid affecting historical data. Instead, any new cases that are created would not have the ability to add that form to the case. Is that viable?

This shouldn't be a hard delete when removing from the workflow. We should set the form to active=0 in the Workflow editor and show it in a different color at the bottom of the list so it is clear it is no longer active.

Dylan Marks The CA200 Forms already has this delete functionality implemented where the workflow form is deleted from the database and the user can add that form back if needed from the enterprise. We implemented the same functionality here with Case Forms and Patient Forms.

If it needs to be implemented in this way as you mentioned above, then I think CA200 Forms will need a re-work as well. What do you suggest?

I don't feel strongly about the CA200 form. If it's not a lot of work then let's redo it to be a soft delete there as well. If it requires extensive changes to APIs or the actual installed software on the tablet, then lets defer.
Kevin Eckhart this will help a lot if implementation team make a mistake in setting up a workflow. Right now it requires going to dev to clear it from the db.
this is great. Ajay Kumar can you confirm what will happen to historical cases that have a complete form that is then delete from the workflow?
My comment from June 1 will be critical: disabling a form should not remove any data associated with it for historical cases.

Dylan Marks This ticket is ready for functional review on the following environment:

Enterprise: https://one-enterprise-devtp08.avizia.com
Code: avizia
Username: blackwell-testing@yopmail.com
Password: Avizia@2018

FYI Asad Zubair Ajay Kumar

Hi Dylan Marks
Just wondering if you had a chance to review this ?
I played around with it and it looks good. One thing to look out for is to also deselect 'Show by Default' on the clinical portal. Im fine with that as a known 'issue' for now.

Hi Dylan Marks , we will be catering the above mentioned issue in BW-10829 To Do , sending this main ticket for CR now.

FYI Ajay Kumar
Ghafran Abbas This is ready for code review on BW-10076 Ready to Push branch.

item.title: [BW-5290] Appointment is not being displayed on Appointment Calendar on staging
item.description:
Steps:
Staging server: https://one-sites-stg.avizia.com/

1. Go to More > Appointments.
2. Create an appointment for any patient, for any facility and clinical module.
3. Save appointment.

Expected:
Appointment should be displayed on the calendar with complete details.

Actual:
Appointment is not being displayed for any patient, clinical module or facility.
item.summary: Appointment is not being displayed on Appointment Calendar on staging

comments.comment:
We have observed that appointments created using serviceline with no workflow defined for them do no show up on Appointments calendar. Works fine when appointment is created using serviceline with workflow defined for it.

Dylan Marks Tuan Do please suggest if the serviceline having no workflow defined for it should not be displayed in the drop down list when creating appointment OR an alert should be displayed that no workflow exist for selected service line

Hassan Abbas Aleeza Hassan FYI

I'd say every serviceLine needs a workflow and if the configuration hasn't been done properly, we should not try to add logic that supports it. I'd say just don't show in the droplist. Implementation team would always add a workflow, but we need to handle if they are half way through adding on and not done that it doesn't the cause the site to stop working.

Let's go with throwing an alert: 'an alert should be displayed that no workflow exist for selected service line'

item.title: [BW-10659] Case Details: Permissions error for user should give more detail
item.description:
Opening based on testing in BW-10634 Ready to Push

If a clinical user tries to open case details for a case that they do not have permissions for, it throws a generic error message instead of says that it is a permissions error.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Configure Case Permissions on settings page in clinical portal to make a case only available to certain groups or roles.
  2. Log in as a user without those groups or roles and navigate directly to the case details page with a direct link.
  3. See a generic error message rather than a permission error.

It should say: "‘You don't have permissions to access this page. Contact your administrator."
item.summary: Case Details: Permissions error for user should give more detail

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

item.title: [BW-6354] Case Permission: If no permission are set then case is allowed all
item.description:
Issue #1:

Steps to Reproduce
1. Login to site (blackwell@avizia.com/Avizia2016)
2. Goto More > Permissions > Case permissions > Can edit case
3. Make sure no permisison are given for any view and edit case

Actual Result

  • User is able to view and edit case even if no permissions are there
    The way current view / edit works - i.e. If no permission set then allow all - this is bad design -

Expected Result
Create a new 'default' group and lets add all users to this group (migration required) - This default group have access to everything. All new users will be added to this group

Issue#2: Page name is appearing as undefined on browser tab
item.summary: Case Permission: If no permission are set then case is allowed all

item.title: [BW-2982] CASE Web: External Survey Link Prompt After Case (Northwell RedCap Sat Surveys)
item.description:
As a patient, I would like to give my satisfaction survey using a custom form designed by Northwell team using software called RedCap.

As a provider, I should be prompted to fill out a custom satisfaction survey opened via a third party link.

  1. Clinical Module Settings on Enterprise Add setting on clinical module to configure this. It may be specific to a certain clinical module (eg only urgent care gets this prompt). Note that these would be customizable per-Clinical Module (Urgent Care might be different from Behavioral Health).
    1. 'Clinical Portal: Completed Case Feedback Enabled' (checkbox to enable)
      1. "Clinical Portal Completed Case Feedback Content Block':
        1. Add multilanguage support for this.
    2. 'Patient Portal: Patient Satisfaction Feedback Custom Content Block'.
      1. "Patient Portal Satisfaction Content Block'
        1. Add multilanguage support for this.
    3. Add Mobile API support to retrieve these settings.
  2. Clinical Case Details: After case is completed (Verify and Compete) show a snackbar popup at the bottom:
    1. Custom Content block below it that can show the external link to RedCap. This content block should be minimal text length in production, eg only the link href with text.
      1. For now this would be a simple button with a href. However, it could theoretically also embed an iframe with the survey. Out of scope, but possible in the future.
    2. OUT OF SCOPE: Question 'How likely are you to recommend this service?' with a 1-10 stars. Provide more feedback here: Underneath it if configured, show the link to external survey url.
      1. Optional multiline textbox with comment.
  3. Patient Portal Add custom content block at the top of the patient satisfaction form. This content block should default to hidden.
    1. OUT OF SCOPE: “How likely is it that you would recommend a virtual visit to a friend or colleague?” Scale 0-10

OUT OF SCOPE:

  1. We have communicated to Northwell that these links cannot be dynamic (not sending CaseID or PatientID or UserID along with the url). We will not build the parameters to the Red Cap specifications. Note that I stuck on adding some data to the urls though, which should not be a big lift on our side.
  2. No single sign on functionality for now.
item.summary: CASE Web: External Survey Link Prompt After Case (Northwell RedCap Sat Surveys)

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment:
Could you expand on what this is for? We should discuss this in more detail before starting dev on it. Is this for the RedCap survey requirement? If so, let's hold off on dev until we have time to discuss internally.

Aaron Harris
We need confirmation from Northwell before we start work on this. Please don't start work on this until then.

Aaron Harris will discuss the RedCap survey integration needs with the customer. IMO, we should deliver this in October after the Phase 1b is complete, since this wasn't in the SOW. I also think we should push for them using our own patient sat and provider sat surveys rather than using RedCap so we can align with needs from other customers.

May possibly align with requirements for customers such as BHP and SOC. SOC has a 'Staff Quality Feedback' form that is prompted after verify and complete is clicked.
BPM-606 Backlog
omar@avizia.com this is the Northwell equivalent.
We may need to use an API to get the proper survey URL. This is possibly getting more complicated. Don't start work on this until we resolve this.

IU Health is wanting their providers to be prompted to fill out a single survey question: “How likely is it that you would recommend a virtual visit to a friend or colleague?”
<<Scale 0-10>>
The question would be prompted after every visit for every clinic module that we implement or have implemented for IU Health.

This needs to a reportable and trackable data point.
We should also look at updating Case Summary PDF/CCD, Mobile API, Reporting, Case Chat, FHIR API if appropriate and necessary.

Dylan Marks Carolena Siliaga I've updated the ticket to capture IU Health request and Parkland is very interested in what IU Health is asking for as well.

@aaron could you run that by Patrick at Northwell as well? Last time we discussed adding the Redcap extra link redirect, he seemed open to having a simple question we ask as well as the Redcap one so we have something for our own records as well.

It’s possible with the complexity of the redcap APIs, we might want to split this discussion in to a separate story but for now let’s keep it together.

Dylan Marks

Summarizing both this one BW-2982 Ready to Push and BW-6246 FUNCTIONAL REVIEW :

Understanding:
---------------------------
1. Add four checkboxes on Clinical Module Screen:

  • Enable Survey for Provider after Case Complete and Cancel.
  • Enable Survey for Provider after Call end.
  • Enable Survey for Patient after Case Complete and Cancel.
  • Enable Survey for Patient after Call end.

2. Make External Survey Link and Content Configurable from enterprise for both Sites and Patients.

3. Open Snackbar on sites and show External Survey Link along with Content coming from enterprise settings:

  • After Call end.
  • After Case Complete and Cancel.

4. Show External Survey Link on Thankyou page on Patients along with Content coming from enterprise settings:

  • After Call end.
  • After Case Complete and Cancel.

Questions:
-----------------------
1. Please confirm, where will we setup the 'Connect Room Feedback Content Block', 'Clinical Portal Completed Case Feedback Content Block' and 'Patient Portal Satisfaction Content Block' contents? Should we take input on the clinical module settings page?
2. Since we are showing External Survey Link (RedCap Survey Link) on the top of internal survey form, does that mean both form can be enabled at the same time? If internal survey form is disabled do we still need to show External Survey form?

Asad Zubair

BW-6246 FUNCTIONAL REVIEW is separate from this as it has nothing to do with clinical modules (since the Connect feature set isn't linked to a clinical module).

  1. I don't think we need four checkboxes. I think this is an 'enable/disable' checkbox, one for provider and one for patient. That is what is scoped in the description. Then underneath that would be an editable content block (html editor like the custom content). This should support multilanguage.
  2. This content is a clinical module setting. No need for a separate setting at the site/portal level.
  3. On clinical app, the content should show in a snackbar when the case is completed. It should not show when the video call ends.
    1. It should show on the Connect module when video call ends but let's focus on that discussion in 6246
  4. For patients, yes we could show on both Call End Thank You page as well as after case complete. For patients, we shouldn't use snackbar but instead embed the html content within the Thank You page and as a section on the completed visit documentation page.
  5. I think we should allow javascript to be embedded in this content editor. For instance, I believe we will end up needing to call some APIs to retrieve the proper RedCap links that have the right context. Better to build in some flexibility if we have to do more aggressive customization for a particular customer.
  6. Discussion point: do you think we need separate content blocks when rendering on mobile? We should include the mobile APIs as part of this development, because we will need to get started on that ASAP.

Kevin Eckhart I was thinking we could actually use this same functionality to prompt to redirect back to the IUH patient portal after the visit is completed. Since we have scoped this as a content block, we could plug in some language to tell the patient to return to their original portal. I think it is IUH that is asking for that functionality (or is it AXA)? Regardless it would be valuable for a lot of our customers that are doing SSO from a patient portal.

Lindsey Cornwell

Dylan Marks
Sounds good.
I was unsure why we have both patient and provider support in here for RedCap Survey, but it sounds like Northwell was asking for this for BOTH patient and providers (vs our standard patient survey).
The above logics and descriptions makes sense to me.

Thanks Dylan Marks , this clears some of the things. However,

1. Content Customization and multilangauge support of Survey for Patients can be achieved from Enterprise `SITES AND PORTALS MANAGEMENT -> PATIENT PORTALS -> portal -> CONTENT CUSTOMIZATION -> Add Content` or we'll have to implement same functionality under `Enable Survey for Patients` checkbox in Clinical Modules. What do you suggest we should do?

2. Multilanguage support doesn't exist in Sites right now. So, we can only implement html editor under `Enable Survey for Sites` checkbox in Clinical Modules or we can implement Content Customization just like in Patient Portal on Enterprise, but this will only work for english for now. What do you suggest?

3. In point 4, by `completed visit documentation page`, do you mean `PAST VISITS -> VISIT DETAILS` in Patients? In this case, Patient can always go to completed cases, click on survey link and fill out the survey multiple times. Would this be acceptable?

Asad Zubair

1. Content customization for this should be clinical module specific, not the same for the whole portal. Thus it will need to be in the Clinical Module settings.
  2. We don't need multilang for Clinical Portals yet. We can put that out of scope.
  3. Can we align this with how we show the patient satisfaction survey? Any time we would show the patient sat survey, we also show this custom content block?

Rach FYI we are going to use a toast for the custom sat survey content block on clinical portal as you recommended. On patient portal it will show in the same place as the usual the patient satisfaction survey.
sounds good!
ayman@avizia.com as discussed I have removed the target ship date from this ticket as this is still in development. Please reschedule for a later release.
Dylan Marks Aaron Harris is the scope on this ticket locked?

ayman@avizia.com

Yes

Asad Zubair

Notes for kevin:

  • Do we want the survey to open in a new link?
  • Experience on the patient portal?

Fatima Danish looking good.

One update, can we force the hyperlink we add to the custom context block to open in a new tab instead of completing a redirect within the active browser.

I’ve configured this on the the ‘TelePediatrics’ clinical module workflow if you need to test.

Kevin EckhartSince the custom content block is capable of parsing html we shouldn’t handle hyperlinks explicitly to open in new tab. Instead, when adding the anchor tag (e.g. <a href=”https://google.com">Google</a>) in custom content block, we can add target=”_blank” in anchor tag to open in new tab (e.g. <a href=”https://google.com” target=”_blank”>Google</a>). This is how you can achieve it, if that's exactly what you require.

P.S. To add `target="_blank"` to anchor tag you would have go into the html view by clicking on `</>` button.
Fatima Danish Asad Zubair

item.title: [BW-10747] Clinical Portal - Case Permissions is not reading Edit permissions properly - Sometimes user is able to edit case
item.description:
This is rarely happening on Prod site whereas it is observed frequently on staging site.

Steps to reproduce:

  • Login on sites as admin
  • Click More > Settings > Permissions > Case Permissions
  • Select a serviceline
  • Set Download PDF/CCD permissions for admin
  • Login from provider, create and complete case
  • Check pdf download permissions
  • From admin, restrict edit rights for admin
  • Refresh case details screen from provider

Actual result:
Provider is able to edit case details after refresh. Happening randomly on Prod

Expected result:
1. Provider should not be able to download pdf
2. Provider should not be able to edit case details
item.summary: Clinical Portal - Case Permissions is not reading Edit permissions properly - Sometimes user is able to edit case

  2. DoB, and first name last name entered in intake step is displayed in Demographics section for Quick Visit

  2. DoB, and first name last name entered in intake step should be displayed in Intake form only

item.title: [BW-11173] Clinical Portal: Site Admin can create an account for a user
item.description:
• Clinical User Profile: Create an account for a user
    1. Add ability to add user to multiple clinical portals with the same role when creating the new account.

‘When we create an account in advance for a user (vs. sending the user an invite), the user should NOT receive an email. There's no need for the user to activate their account because it's being created in advance. This is especially important for clients like HonorHealth where the Providers need a user account in order to appear on the On Call Schedule, however the providers never actually access the site. For other clients, when we're setting up user accounts in advance, the client admin or Implementation Manager sends an email to the user manually with their temporary password and advises the user to reset the password.’

NOTE: This change is also need to be done when account is created via Enterprise
item.summary: Clinical Portal: Site Admin can create an account for a user
