item.title: [BW-10755] Dignity: Make on-call contact preferences that appear on calendar event dynamic
item.description:
Issue: Currently, when an on call calendar event is created and a provider's default contact preference(s) are used, what displays on the On Call Summary page event details page and Providers On Call report are the default contact preferences from the time of call calendar creation. Therefore, if a call calendar was created 6-months ago, and the provider at some point changes their contact preferences on their user profile, the On Call Summary page event details page and Providers On Call report will show the old default contact preferences (not the current).

Request:

  1. Make the numbers displayed on the On Call Summary page event details page and Providers On Call report dynamic so that they always show the current default contact preferences based on what the Provider selects in their contact preferences.
    1. Per Dylan, we should not be copying any contact information into the calendar event. The calendar event table should either be a blank entry (aka default to the provider's contact preference) or the name of the modality. It should not hard code the actual phone number in that table in case the provider changes it in the future.
  2. On the Individual and Bulk calendar creation pages, change the Provider Contact Preference label to "Override provider's contact preference?".
    1. The Default should say something like, "Use Provider Preferences - Recommended"
    2. Add a divider with a section title called "Override Preferences" (Groups menu shows this title concept >> https://design.avizia.io/clinical-desktop/components/preview/des-portal-c-menus.html)
    3. Show the drop-down list of numbers to pick from in the event user is over-riding the default.
    4. Note: The purpose is to make it really obvious that selecting a contact method other than default is over-riding what the provider has chosen (note: it's a bad idea for the majority of use cases (other than Honor Health))
  3. Make sure the on-call contact numbers continue to appear on the On Call Summary page event details page and Providers On Call report even if the user is looking at a day in the future (this is how it works today)
    1. In other words, if I click on the On Call Summary page and click on a future date. When I click on the on call calendar event I will still see the contact preferences listed.

Rach Dylan Marks
item.summary: Dignity: Make on-call contact preferences that appear on calendar event dynamic

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment:
This is why I think we should train and encourage Dignity to not use the call calendar contact preference. It goes stale and prevents the provider from updating their preferences on the fly. It’s also why I’m advocating all those changes to the Directory page so that you can see both the calendar event contact preference as well as the provider’s current contact preferences on their profile.

Unless you are referring to something different Julie Henderson ?

1. We should not be copying any contact information into the calendar event. The calendar event table should either be a blank entry (aka default to the provider's contact preference) or the name of the modality. It should not hard code the actual phone number in that table in case the provider changes it in the future.
  2. Let's change the labels to make it really obvious that using this feature is a bad idea for the majority of use cases (other than Honor Health)
Rach, can you please approve or modify #2 and #2-1 in the revised Description? Thanks!
Julie Henderson updated

Dylan Marks Julie Henderson
The issue in this ticket description was not reproducible. Contact Number is being reflected on all pages of On Call Scheduler when updated.

1. Need more clarification on this please:
`Per Dylan, we should not be copying any contact information into the calendar event. The calendar event table should either be a blank entry (aka default to the provider's contact preference) or the name of the modality. It should not hard code the actual phone number in that table in case the provider changes it in the future.`
2. On the Individual and Bulk calendar creation pages, change the Provider Contact Preference label to "Override provider's contact preference?".
3. The Default placeholder in `Provider Contact Preference` dropdown would say, "No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference".
4. If "No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference" is selected, default Contact Preferences in Providers Profile should be shown on all Pages of `On Call Scheduler`.
4. Updated Contact Preferences should be seen at all times in all the Pages of `On Call Scheduler`.
Asad Zubair

Sorry, could you clarify your question? For 2-4, these are label changes in the scheduler interface. See the screenshots for where this is located.

Regarding this 'hard coding number in table', while testing we were noticing that when a provider is scheduled and contact pref is set in the calendar event, and then the provider changes their phone number, the old phone number still showed on the calendar event contact preference. Perhaps this is no longer happening, but that was the concern for Issue #1.

Regarding #1, I just tested again and this is working now. I changed my Primary On Call Contact Preference and that change is reflected on the On Call Schedule dashboard and the Provider On Call Report. Thank you!

Dylan Marks Just need to confirm 2 things:-

  • Do we still need to show label "No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference", if provider hasn't selected his contact-preference (primary) yet.
  • In the drop down do we still need to show star (`*`) on the number, that is selected as contact-preference (primary).

My two cents... Dylan Marks , do you agree?

  • Do we still need to show label "No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference", if provider hasn't selected his contact-preference (primary) yet. JH: No, don't show this label if the provider hasn't made any selections.
  • In the drop down do we still need to show star (`*`) on the number, that is selected as contact-preference (primary). JH: Yes, please continue to show a * next to the primary on call contact preference.

Dylan Marks Julie Henderson we came across a flow during testing that onCall-schedule creation, if a user explicitly selects 'his primary contact preference' from the drop-down plus the label 'No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference'.

Then the schedule will display the number twice (one explicitly selected and the other one comes dynamically from the currently selected primary-contact-preference):

Is it ok to show that number twice?
Note: Later when the user changes his primary-contact-preference from the profile, then the dynamic number will automatically be replaced by new number. (as shown below):

FYI Nimra Khursheed sajidbarkaat.10p

Julie Henderson

This ticket is ready for functional review on https://one-sites-devtp01.avizia.com
Code for the site: clinic
Credentials for the site is blackwell-testing@yopmail.com/Avizia@2018

We have found one existing issues during testing, will be catered here ( BW-11545 To Do )

CC: Asad Zubair Ajay Kumar

Nimra Khursheed hassan-ali-10p - I'm getting on a flight and haven't been able to functionally review yet, but to answer the question above, no, we can't display the number twice. It will cause too much confusion. So need to find a solution.
Dylan Marks
I don’t think it should allow the scheduled to select a contact modality AND ‘No, defer to the provider’s...’ option at the same time. The ‘No’ should be mutually exclusive.

And while we are at it, I think it should default to the ‘No’ option on scheduler. We want to encourage schedulers to not override a provider’s contact preference, which the provider may want to change on the fly mid shift if their situation changes (Eg their phone dies so they want calls redirected to their office phone).

Dylan Marks we are currently working to implement your suggested feedback. However, we are now out of time to complete this implementation in time for the 9.18 release. So we have 2 options

  1. We can release the ticket as is for 9.18 and implement the above feedback in a separate ticket.
  2. We can accommodate the feedback by rescheduling the ticket for the 9.27 release.

How would you like us to proceed ?
Hi Dylan Marks I have had to move this out to the 9.27 release since it is now too late for us to release this on 9.18. We will release it with your feedback above.
That’s fine, thanks.

Julie Henderson Dylan Marks We came across one more scenario during testing: As per old functionality if a provider selects a Secondary on-call contact preference in his profile then by default that number is shown as selected in his on-schedule dropdown while creating on-call scheduler.
Now if provider selects both Primary on-call and Secondary on-call contact preference in his profile then label of 'No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference’ is not appearing as mutually exclusive due to old functionality.

So, should we remove this number from default selection and only keep 'No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference' option selected as default?
FYI Nimra Khursheed sajidbarkaat.10p

hassan-ali-10p - It seems that adding the "No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference" option in the drop-down is making this complicated... is that the issue? If so, Dylan Marks can we get rid of that option and handle via training? (Meaning make it clear in training guide that it's not recommended to override the provider's contact preference)

Either way, I just want to recap what's needed:

  1. Per current functionality, whatever is selected in user's profile for primary on-call and secondary on-call need to be the default selection when creating on-call scheduler.
  2. When clicking on the drop-down (for contact preference during on call schedule build), the primary on-call number needs to be checked and have an * next to it so Scheduler can easily confirm what the primary number is (current functionality)
  3. The secondary on call number needs to have a check-mark as well, again so the Scheduler can easily confirm that it's accurate (this is current functionality)
  4. All other contact numbers in the user profile that are enabled need to also appear in the drop-down (current functionality)
  5. New requirement in this ticket: If the provider updates their default contact preferences in their user profile, and default contact preferences were used during call calendar build, the new number(s) will appear in the call schedule view.
  6. Scheduler can choose to uncheck preferred numbers (although training guides will make it clear that this is not best practice) and make other selections. In this case, change to the user profile will not be automatically updated in call schedule view (current functionality)

Hi Julie Henderson / Dylan Marks ,

We have now removed the secondary contact number display from the default selection, to make the logic consistent with the primary contact number display.

Please review on the environment below and advise if this looks better.

Site URL: https://one-sites-devtp05.avizia.com
Site code: clinic
Credentials : blackwell-testing@yopmail.com/Avizia@2018

CC: Asad Zubair hassan-ali-10p Ajay Kumar

Nimra Khursheed - The secondary on-call contact preference has to appear when viewing the on call provider contact detail. This is a contractual requirement for Dignity Health. With the changes made, the secondary contact preference doesn't not display.

Testing Steps:

  1. I populated Tuan's user account with primary and secondary on call contact preferences; made sure both numbers were then turned to ON/Always.
  2. When building the Cardiology1 on call calendar, I used the default contact preferences
  3. When viewing the on call provider contact details, the secondary contact preference doesn't appear. Expected Behavior: Secondary contact preference needs to appear (when it's selected in user profile and set to ON).

Dylan Marks - Can you please review my comments from 9/14? I'm concerned that adding this option "No, defer to the provider's up-to-date contact preference" in the drop-down is making this too complicated. Again, even when choosing the default contact preferences, the Scheduler will want to see what the primary and secondary contact preferences are to double check for accuracy. The way we have this feature today (prior to adding the "No, defer to..." option), the Scheduler could see both primary and secondary options checked and highlighted in blue, and both options appeared in on call provider's contact detail window.

Additional Testing:
I changed Tuan's on call contact preferences on his user profile and they automatically updated on the contact detail window - PASSED.

Discussed with Nimra this morning and with Julie this afternoon.

For how it is implemented in code, I recommended changing approach, where the default is ‘NULL’ for the oncall_schedules.selectedPreference. If NULL, then it should look to the user’s My Profile for the primary and secondary contact preference. The previous iteration, Nimra was setting a ‘Primary Contact’ in the oncall_schedule.selectedPreference. Better to have it null, which indicates everywhere that it should be looking at the preferences in My Profile and rendering both primary and secondary from there.

The goal with this ticket is to ideally have this be NULL for 95% of scheduled times. Emphasize to the scheduler that they should not be explicitly setting the contact preference in the scheduled times so instead it defers to the provider’s realtime settings.

Places where this oncall_schedules.selectedPreference would be rendered:

  1. On the mobile app: directory page + schedule page
  2. On the Directory Details page (/user-details/user-ghafran)

Discussed with Julie and we were wondering if we could change scope here to show different labels. This is based on iterative review of what is done so far on devtp05.

  1. Change the question label to ‘Contact Preference’
  2. Change the default option to ‘Use contact preferences from profile: ’
    1. Can we render what those actual preferences are? Eg show the primary + secondary in the label. See the screenshot. Eg. “Use contact preferences from profile: c: 555-555-5555*, o:555-444-4444”
    2. For each of the modalities, “Override to show “ + modality name.
      1. eg “Override to show Answering: 8888976654 *”
Dylan Marks thanks for the clarification.

Dylan Marks just wan’t to mention one more thing that in case we are binding NULL database value, to ui-label Use contact preferences from profile: c: 555-555-5555*, o:555-444-4444.

When a user, during schedule creation, doesn’t select any value from the drop-down, then automatically NULL gets saved in database. So, when user will display that schedule detail page , then his profile-preference number(s) will appear on schedule, even if he didn’t selected any option from the drop down during schedule creation.
Perfect thanks.

Hi Julie Henderson Dylan Marks , this is ready for functional review on https://one-sites-devtp08.avizia.com

Code: clinic
Credentials: blackwell-testing@yopmail.com/Avizia@2018
Julie Henderson did you get a chance to review this ticket ?

hassan-ali-10p , Ajay Kumar - Really nice work on this. I tested the following scenarios and all passed:

  • Label changed to ‘Contact Preference’ on Individual, Bulk-fixed and Bulk-Rolling - PASSED
  • Default now says "Use contact preferences from profile" on Individual, Bulk-fixed and Bulk-Rolling - PASSED
  • The Contact Preference drop-down has “Override to show..." options for the other numbers - PASSED
  • After calendar build is complete, changing the Primary/Secondary preference automatically changes display number on event detail (from on call dashboard) and contact detail in Directory - PASSED
  • Selected override # for Temp Account 1 for one calendar and used their default contact preferences for a second calendar, and then changed the default preferences - it only updated the calendar where default preferences were selected - PASSED

One small detail - hoping it's a quick fix - when creating a bulk-fixed calendar, the contact preference drop-down shows the check-mark for "use contact preferences from profile" over the text. See image. Anything we can do about that?

Julie Henderson Thanks.
We have fixed the above mentioned check-mark issue also. Here’s the screen shot of the fix.

Casey Stein This ticket is ready for code-review. Here’s the PR link:
https://bitbucket.org/avizia/one/pull-requests/10834
Dylan Marks Julie Henderson Juan rogers - Is this working as expected on touchpoint app to mimic web?
We should test. Alexey Marenych could you review this changeset and tell us if it would cause problems on mobile?
Dylan Marks Julie Henderson - What is the expected behavior if the provider didn't set their contact preference? What should show in the dropdown?

Poojitha Dontu - All numbers entered into the provider's user profile will appear in the drop-down. If the provider selected one/two of those numbers as primary/secondary contact preferences, they would appear as default during calendar creation but those numbers plus any others would appear in the drop-down.
Dylan Marks sure. Alexander Veprik did the review on this.

item.title: [BW-11292] Dignity: Opens wrong provider for messaging from On-Call Calendar
item.description:
As a nurse trying to message the on-call provider, I should be able to click on the provider in the call calendar, click message, and open a message window with that provider so that I can quickly contact the right on call provider.

When I opened the Behavioral Health on-call calendar in STAGING, I clicked on Rajesh since he was the primary on call doctor. There was a secondary on call provider named Russell Smith. When I click on Rajesh it opened a modal with an option to click "message." When I clicked message, it took me to the message page with Russell Smith. I saw a message with Rajesh available in the left sidebar but the window with Russell was active. When I typed a message it went to Russell.

I tried this again in another calendar for Hand surgery. The primary contact was Jane Jones and secondary is Rajesh. When I click on Jane it opens the modal and I select message. On the message page, I'm in an acitive window with Jane (Good). I go back to the on call calendar and again select Hand Surgery. I click on Rajesh this time and choose Message in the modal. It opens the message page with an active window for Jane Jones (Fail).
item.summary: Dignity: Opens wrong provider for messaging from On-Call Calendar

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

Verified that user is navigated to respective chat window when clicking any provider schedule via Calendar.

However while verification of ticket some issues were observed regarding On call scheduler which have been logged under BW‌-11557 and will be catered separately.

CC Ajay Kumar Fahad Abdullah

Hi Lindsey Cornwell

The ticket is available for Functional review on
https://one-sites-devtp06.avizia.com/

Sana Ejaz the Fred Jones doctors work just fine but the Blackwell Admin opens a room instead of a direct message with Dr. Blackwell Admin. That doesn’t seem like normal behavior.

Julie Henderson FYI

Lindsey Cornwell Yes, it’s a known a issue and already logged under BW‌-11557

The issue occurred when Logged in user send a message to himself and for each message a new room will be created. steps are as follows.

  1. Create On call schedule for user-A
  2. Now login in to sites as User A > Navigate to On call scheduler screen > select your own schedule from calendar > Click message button > Send a message to yourself.

CC Ajay Kumar
Sana Ejaz Thank you for clarifying. Then this passes functional review. I believe it goes to Code Review next so I’ve assigned it back to you. This shouldn’t need design review since it was a bug.
ayman@avizia.com - This is Ready to Push. Can we please get a Target Ship Date? Thank you!

Kevin Eckhart Julie Henderson Aaron Harris Lauren Kokernak - are you seeing this issue with any customers in production?

Linus Park Krysta Scharlach - have you gotten any customer support tickets about this?

Poojitha Dontu - This issue is happening on all prod sites from what I can tell. IU Health is the prod client I'm most concerned will discover it. Dev on this ticket is complete, hoping we can get it into an earlier release or fix.
Increasing the priority here since it is impacting live customers, but I wouldn’t say its a blocker.

item.title: [BW-12011] Gateway: Inbound Scheduling (New) calls failed on Gateway's listener server for Parkland
item.description: Appointment calls sent from Parkland failed on Gateway's inbound interface. On investigation of logs it was uncovered that the listener fails to pass on the call to router server. The issue was resolved when the listener, router and dispatcher services were restarted.
item.summary: Gateway: Inbound Scheduling (New) calls failed on Gateway's listener server for Parkland

item.description:

  • Pokitdok should be enabled

Steps to reproduce:

  2. Start a new visit
  3. Complete visit creation for paid service line using insurance plan
  4. Log in on admin

item.title: [BW-8683] Northwell: unable to login with SSO from the mobile
item.description:
Unable to login with SSO account to Northwell.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Take testflight Avizia app (10.12)
2. Enter Pin: 1821
3. Tap "SSO Login"
4. Enter username/password for the valid SSO user

Expected: User is logged in.
Actual. Error "Something wrong happened" displayed.

After the investigation we found out that request to One provider API returns incorrect response:
requesst:

{  
   "uri":"https://one-api-prod.avizia.com/v1/mobile/provider/auth/provider/login",
   "method":"POST",
   "body":"{\"site_id\":\"86bddc46-589f-4778-933e-7eb70caa709e\",\"silent_token\":\"df63116b-3c64-41de-9a3e-57024c24cf9f\"}",
   "headers":{  
      "Content-Type":"application/json",
      "Authorization":"Credential=mobile_device-prod-0917,Window=1520878423745,Signature=31e645be61e7a9d780464b722181e9802bc94517d99f1a79abebd30dbd5966d9,Enterprise=northwell"
   },
   "simple":true
}

Response:

"{"status":423,"message":"Your account has been deactivated. Please contact your site's administrator.","type":"accountLocked"}"

Should we pass error messages to the user? Does this still work on the web? Which site name we can use to check this enterprise on the web?
item.summary: Northwell: unable to login with SSO from the mobile

comments.comment:
Monitoring this for clinical mobile SSO issue on prod.
Lauren Kokernak Julie Henderson
We need to test with our internal ADFS to see if the issue is different. Working on that here: BW-8676 Done
aprihodko Is it happening for all users? As per error message, it looks user account is inactive in one database.

Zaheer Ahmed
We can access to single user only:
Username: aviziatest

Although, this user still can login on the web. So it is confusing, so either Web let deactivated user in, or Mobile API works ncorrectly.
Faisal Islam can share password for the affected account

Question: if we have deactivated a user in Avizia, do we still allow SSO of that user and reactivate the user in Avizia? Or do we throw an error and prevent continuing?

In my opinion, we should always defer to the SSO Identity Provider (aka ADFS). Thus if we have deactivated the user in Avizia, when that user clicks through from ADFS, we should automatically re-activate the user and log them in.

If this works differently for web and mobile, then that would explain the issue. We should change the mobile API to include the re-activation workflow.

Currently in mobile, when an user is deactivated in Avizia, then they are not able to log into the mobile app. The mobile app needs to be updated to work as it does in the web.

Lowering the priority of this ticket since the user is able to log in with SSO account.

Asad Zubair
Why it was assigned to me? I believe issue was spotted, and requires fix from One/One API side.
>>we should automatically re-activate the user and log them in.
Sorry about that aprihodko I meant to assign it to myself and take it out of my dev queue since the priority was lowered. Thanks for assigning it back to me.
Juan rogers or Dylan Marks is this still an issue?

item.title: [BW-3559] Report - Users Registered
item.description:
Dignity Health needs to be able to run a report that shows all clinical users who are registered in the system. This report should pull from the users table.
DH Note: This is an annual review requirements for DH Compliance. Any provider using the mobile app is charged $60 fee and that fee is applied towards the provider's De Minimis account on an annual basis. Any registered provider qualifies for this attribution.

Columns to include in the report:

  1. User ID
  2. First Name
  3. Last Name
  4. Credential(s)
  5. Specialty(ies)
  6. Date created
  7. Other requirements:
    1. Dignity needs to be able to see the Clinical Portal to which the user has access - confirm user can do this via filters
    2. User needs to be able to select a start/end date to run the report.

8/6/18 note: Adding non-MVP fields to a phase 2 Jira ( CRB-46 Approved ).
item.summary: Report - Users Registered

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment:
Andrew Phelps - Dignity's requirements for this report are:

  1. Offered Excel format
  2. Must look the same or better than the report now
  3. Must be able to select Facility or Region (Portal)
  4. Must be able to select date/date range
  5. Must have User ID
  6. Must have First Name
  7. Must have Last Name
  8. Must have Degree
  9. Must have Specialty
  10. Must have Date created
  11. Must have Last Mobile login
  12. Must have last Web login

Can you please confirm that user will be able to select the date range (#4). Also, will the report show last mobile login (#11) and last web login (#12)? All other points are included in your original scope.
Stephanie Smith

Julie Henderson Date Range refers to a filter on the User Created date? We can filter on that. I asked Priyank Maiya about the mobile and web login. He was not certain, but thought we could build a capability to record those data points.

Thank you Andrew Phelps. Here's the use case for DH: "I want to run a report from 1/1/17 - 12/31/2017 to see all users who have an Avizia account in 2017, including their last mobile login and last web login. This is an annual review requirements for DH Compliance. Any provider using the mobile app is charged $50 fee annually."

Julie Henderson - this report will not answer that question. A users registered report will tell you who is currently registered in the system, and when they registered. The last mobile login date might answer this question, but you would need to run the report at 12-31-2017 11:59 PM. As soon as someone logs-in after that date, their last login will get overwritten with a 2018 date, meaning it would appear as if they had not logged in during 2017.
If this is an annual review requirement, we can probably write a query that will tell Dignity which of their users was active on the mobile app at some point during a given year. Because this is such a unique requirement, do we need to build it into the platform as an on-demand report? Especially given they need the information once a year?
sajidbarkaat.10p - When will you be able to get started on this ticket? Thank you.

Hi Julie Henderson

Is it going to be an on demand query or a report built into the system ?

Regards

sajidbarkaat.10p, My apologies for the delay in response. I was out of the office. This needs to be offered in excel format and can be a data extract like the On Call Schedules Audit Extract. Thank you.

Hi Julie Henderson

Thanks for the reply. I've started looking into it after fulfilling other assignments. I'd like to bring your attention to following requirements. Because a functionality needs to built into the system first to record these data points.

Must have Last Mobile login
Must have last Web login

Regards

sajidbarkaat.10p, thanks for brining that to our attention. Do you have any level of effort estimate for capturing those? I'll talk to Julie Henderson today to understand how critical this is for Dignity.

FYI... I just sent the following email to Candy (DH):
Hi Candy,
We need some clarification on 2-fields that were included in your requirement for the Users Registered Report – 1) last mobile login and 2) last web login.

I had the following use case in my notes for the reason why we need these two fields in the Users Registered Report:
"I want to run a report from 1/1/17 - 12/31/2017 (example dates) to see all users who have an Avizia account in 2017, including their last mobile login and last web login. This is an annual review requirements for DH Compliance. Any provider using the mobile app is charged $50 fee annually."

In our development effort so far, we do not have last mobile login and last web login fields. When evaluating the level of effort to add this functionality, the question came up if this detail will meet the annual review requirement need anyway. The Users Registered report will tell you who is currently registered in the system, and when they registered. If we add the last mobile/web login date, it will only answer this question if the Users Registered report is run at exactly 12-31-2017 11:59 PM. As soon as someone logs-in after that date/time, their last login will be overwritten with a 2018 date, meaning it would appear as if they had not logged in during 2017. When talking this through with Andrew Phelps, if this annual review requirement is in fact only needed once or twice a year, his suggestion is that we instead write a query that will tell Dignity which of their users was active on the mobile/web app at some point during a given year. DH would just need to let us know when they need this information and we’ll provide it.

With that said, was there any other use for last mobile login and last web login that makes it a must-have requirement for go live? We’re trying to be laser focused on where to spend development time given the amount of work that needs to be completed for DH so we appreciate your feedback and consideration.

Hi Lindsey Cornwell

I believe development effort is about 18 hours.

Regards

Hi Julie Henderson

Can you please confirm columns returned by the query. My understanding is only following columns will be part of the query.

User ID
First Name
Last Name
Degree
Specialty
Date created
Last Mobile login
Last Web login

In case all the columns from original scope are to be returned can you please confirm where are following two columns displayed/used in our application (Clinical Portal/Patient Portal/Enterprise Portal)

Insurance Name
Insurance Group

Regards

Andrew Phelps - Dignity only needs the following fields in the Users Registered Report. You have several other fields listed in the Description of this ticket. For MVP, are you OK with only including the fields below?

User ID
First Name
Last Name
Credential(s)
Specialty(ies)
Date created
Last Mobile login
Last Web login

sajidbarkaat.10p - Dignity needs to be able to 1) See the Clinical Portal to which the user has access, and 2) Select a start/end date to run the report. Would the user be able to accomplish both of these things via setting the filters on the Clinical Portal Reporting page (prior to running the extract)? Or, do you suggest we add a column in the report for Clinical Portal(s)?

Julie Henderson - the fields I came up with are based mainly on feature parity with v7. In your original comment on this ticket, item #2 for Dignity's requirements is "Must look the same or better than the report now." By only including the eight fields, it will not look the same as the v7 report.
However, you are closer to the customer than I am, so I'll defer to you and Lindsey on what is MVP.

The full set of fields will be useful for other customers, I know Northwell is also waiting for a report like this. They would probably like to see the full list of fields, rather than the truncated 8 on an MVP.

Andrew Phelps - In talking with Lindsey Cornwell, we need to keep the MVP scope as minimal as possible given the number of DH requirements and the other non-DH development work that needs to be done this year.

sajidbarkaat.10p, I confirmed that for MVP, Candy only needs the following fields. I will update the Description. I will move Last Mobile login and Last Web login to a separate ticket (post-MVP) along with the other non-required fields.

  1. User ID
  2. First Name
  3. Last Name
  4. Credential(s)
  5. Specialty(ies)
  6. Date created

sajidbarkaat.10p - One remaining question: Dignity needs to be able to 1) See the Clinical Portal to which the user has access, and 2) Select a start/end date to run the report. The user be able to accomplish both of these things via setting the filters on the Clinical Portal Reporting page (prior to running the extract), correct?

Hi Julie Henderson

Yes you are correct, the user will be able to accomplish following tasks via setting the filters on Clinical Portal Reporting Page.

1) See the Clinical Portal to which the user has access
2) Select a start/end date to run the report

Start and End date filters are already in the report. We will add Clinical Portal filter too for this particular report.

Regards
sajidbarkaat.10p Sana Ejaz - How is this ticket coming along? Please let me know when it's ready for Functional Review. Thanks.

Hi Julie Henderson

This ticket is also not available on dev environment just like BW-8543 Shipped . Sana Ejaz had run basic tests. Detailed testing was in progress when this happened.

BW-8543 Shipped comment by me is as follows for reference

Hi [~jhenderson]

I believe the ticket is not available on dev environment anymore. This might be because of branching strategy coming into effect late last week. *Dev* environment may not be available for testing anymore. And it is the only environment that has DB Collector service running. This service is necessary to run data extracts. 

I Will discuss with [~priyank] and see which other environment can be used to test data extracts. Then will  update you accordingly.

Regards

Hi Julie Henderson

Since the dev environment that we used for reviewing reporting tickets like these has been repurposed for the new branching process, we are unable to send this to you for review until this ticket reaches the staging environment.

Would you be ok with reviewing this ticket on stage ?

Verified that Provider details extract report can be generated and downloaded properly w.r.t applied filters ( i-e Date and clinical portal) on dev insance. Further observations are as under,

item.title: [BW-8603] Session does not timeout appropriately
item.description:
Steps to reproduce

  1. Navigate to enterprise > Sites & Portal Managment > Clinical Portals > Select appropriate portal > Security
  2. Set session to timeout for fifteen minutes
  3. Repeat steps 1-2 for the Patient Portal
  4. Navigate and login to the recently updated clinical and patient portals
  5. Leave those pages idle for at least fifteen minutes
  6. Attempt to navigate around clinical/patient portals

Issues

  • Clinical portal seems to not timeout unless left for thirty minutes, even when set to fifteen
  • Patient portal seems to not timeout even after thirty minutes
item.summary: Session does not timeout appropriately

comments.comment: This appears to currently be an issue in prod, as well.

item.title: [BW-6505] Url Case sensitivity issue
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce
1. Access enterprise URL
2. Login to enterprise
3. Access URL https://one-enterprise-devtp03.avizia.com/sites/edit/clinic/data
4. Now change URL in capital letters
5. Access URL https://one-enterprise-devtp03.avizia.com/sites/edit/Clinic/data

Expected Behavior
page should be reloaded with no change

Actual Behavior
Date is not appearing

Url-Case-Sensitive_1.mp4 Url-Case-Sensitive_2.mp4

item.title: [BW-3319] Vidyo: All filled values gets reset on Vidyo Setting and Endpoint settings once validation message appear
item.description:
Issue #1: All filled values gets reset on Vidyo Setting and Endpoint settings once validation message appear

Steps to Reproduce
1. Login to enterprise
2. Goto Other Setting > Vidyo Setting
3. Enter values in all filed but leave tenant ID empty
4. Click on 'Save' button
5. Validation message will appear for Tenant ID and all filled values will be reset

Actual Result
Validation message will appear for Tenant ID and all filled values will be reset

Expected Behavior
Once validation message appear for any particular field , other fields should not be reset.

Note: This is happening for Enterprise > Endpoint > Vidyo

Issue #2: Facility information set while adding Vidyo end point is not shown on grid

Steps to Reproduce
1. Login to enterprise
2. Goto Endpoints
3. Click on 'Add Endpoint'
4. Add Vidyo end point
5. Enter values in all fields and save

Actual Result
Facility details not appearing in grid

Expected Result
Facility details should appear in grid
item.summary: Vidyo: All filled values gets reset on Vidyo Setting and Endpoint settings once validation message appear

item.title: [BW-3310] Vidyo: Call is not initiated if user update Vidyo Settings
item.description:
If user initiate a call with vidyo setting and then update the vidyo setting and then again initiate a vidyo call for the same case then console error appears.
As room is already created with previous user for that case and its open.

Steps to Reproduce
1. Login into enterprise
2. Add vidyo settings on Enterprise
3. Login to Site with provider user
4. Initiate a vidyo call for case whose endpoint is set against facility and provider endpoint is set
5. Call will be initiated
6. Now end the call
7. Now update the Vidyo setting to other user on enterprise
8. Initiate call for the same case
9. Console error will appear and call will not be initiated
item.summary: Vidyo: Call is not initiated if user update Vidyo Settings

item.title: [BW-3316] Vidyo: Invite is sent to user but still user busy/offline message is appearing
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce
1. Make sure both facility endpoint Vidyo Address and provider endpoint Vidyo Address are offline.
2. Login to site with provider.
3. Initiate a Vidyo call for that facility.
4. Alert message will appear stating both user are busy.
5. Now login to vidyo deskstop with any one user e.g. user 1.
6. Now again click on 'Join Video'.
7. Alert message will appear user 2 is busy/offline and user 1 will be sent invite.
8. Call will be initiated
9. Now login to vidyo deskstop with user2
10. Now again click on 'Join Video'.
11. Alert message will appear user 2 is busy/offline however user 2 will be sent invite.
item.summary: Vidyo: Invite is sent to user but still user busy/offline message is appearing

item.title: [BW-11751] Clinical Portal > Message thread should be refreshed for all participants when any message is deleted during conversation.
item.description:
*Steps *

  • Let user ( A,B & C ) logged in to clinical portal and started conversation via messages. 1:1 OR Group conversation
  • Let any of the participant delete a message during conversation.

Current result
Message was removed immediately for the user who deleted it. The other users needed to refresh or click to another page on the site and then back into Messages in order for the message to delete.

Expected result
Message should be deleted for all users involved in conversation immediately.

Also:
1. Update so that only the user who added the message can delete it. Other users should only be able to view the message.
2. When a message is deleted, all participants in the message should see that a message was deleted.
item.summary: Clinical Portal > Message thread should be refreshed for all participants when any message is deleted during conversation.

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment:
There were also two issues found related to deleting message

1 - Currently anyone can delete other user’s message and like another chatting module it should be like this , user can delete own message only not others

2 - When message is deleted (archived) it should display that message was deleted from here
If we you agree with these then we can fix it in same ticket it would take slightly more time but will make this module more appropriate, let us know with your suggestion about this
Lindsey Cornwell Julie Henderson
cc : Sana Ejaz Asad Zubair

Sana Ejaz
Issue mentioned in description is fixed

Fahad Abdullah and Sana Ejaz,
I agree with 1. For 2 are you saying that we need a confirmation that the message was deleted for ALL users to see? Or just the user who deleted it?

Julie Henderson

For all users confirmation should be shown like whatsapp displays when message was deleted but skype do not has this feature like this no confirmation shows when message is deleted ,currently which we already have. Its up to us whatever fit in our business model.
Fahad Abdullah Sana Ejaz this makes sense. I confirmed with Julie offline so let’s do it. Julie Henderson

Verified the ticket as per updated description and observations are as under.

  • Only sender is allowed to delete a message. [i-e Gear icon icon will be displayed against a message which is send by user himself]

  • whenever a message is deleted, ‘Delete message’ will be displayed and chat window will be updated immediately for each participant.

Fahad Abdullah as per our discussion, following issues being observed during the verification of ticket.

Sana Ejazfor the message about a deleted message: can we make it look like like a user message? That has confused us when testing and seeing a message from "User three: User three has left the group." It looks like it could have been typed by the user. Is there a way to display this outside of the "text bubble" that either says, "You deleted this message" or "Message deleted by author?"

Rach what do you think from a visual perspective? I did a quick mock up to show what I mean.

Lindsey Cornwell currently we made changes for deleted message so far that we have changed its text color and added block sign as shown in image

which is different from user left chat room and other messages
Just confirming that we need to remove its bubble look and show plain message without background color ?
let me get Rachto weigh in.

Lindsey Cornwell Fahad Abdullah

https://design.avizia.io/clinical-desktop/v1-stable/components/preview/messages-v-1-1.html

Inline notifications are white bubbles.
Notification Messages Patterns : https://design.avizia.io/clinical-desktop/components/preview/des-portal-c-messaging.html
Thanks, Rach I think that will look much clearer than using the same bubbles as incoming messages. Fahad Abdullah let us know if you have any more questions.
Fahad Abdullah Can you make sure the message is “Lindsey Cornwell deleted the message” and not a generic author.
Lindsey Cornwell in slack, when one person deletes a message, the other participants see it disappearing. This is a nice action to have.

Hi Rach

Your suggestion above is different to the original request. What we have implemented is that when a message is deleted, users see a message saying that the message is deleted, rather than the message disappearing.

Lindsey Cornwell could you confirm if we should change our implementation based on the above ?

Asad Zubair
I spoke to Rach and we don't want to change the experience: we still want to use the notifications from the Pattern library to display that the message is no longer visible. However, when it comes to refreshing, we want to make sure that the experience doesn't jolt the user. So if I'm in an active conversation, I want to see that the other participant deleted a message but I don't want my entire page to refresh. Otherwise I'll think there as a system glitch of some kind.

Instead of "Lindsey Cornwell deleted the message." Can you show the user who deleted the message and say, "Message no longer visible." We want to use language that is clear that the message isn't deleted from the back office.

item.title: [BW-10347] View screen share/image share as external participant
item.description:
Current State: Screensharing functionality is currently only available with authenticated participants.

Customer Use Case: Advocate only uses the Connect Module and would like to enable screensharing functionality for non-authenticated participants (i.e. those who are invited via an email link) in this tool; it should also work for unregistered participants who are invited via v10.

User Acceptance Criteria:

1. All users on browsers, with the exception of IE should be able to screenshare in the Connect Module.
2. IE users should be able to share PDFs and image files in the Connect Module between participants in a conference room.
3. All unregistered users invited via v10 should be able to view the providers' screen or image share whether logging in via the provider app or Web ( BW-10315 Done should add viewing capabilities from the mobile app)

cc Kevin Eckhart
item.summary: View screen share/image share as external participant

item.title: [BW-11365] Web Clinical Portal: Delete single message
item.description:
Right now on web, you can click on the gear shift in a single message and it provides the option to "Archive Message." It would be clearer to say "Delete Message."

In the modal that appears, title it "Permanently Delete Message" and ask, "Do you want to delete this message for all users?" <Cancel> <Yes>

If the user selects yes, the message will be removed from their thread as well as the thread for any other users. 

Given that a user wants to delete a single message (either text or image)

and they are on the Web

When they click the gear shift next to a single message

and see the message "Delete message"

and click it

Then they should be prompted with a text box with the title "Permanently Delete Message"

and see the question, "Do you want to delete this message for all users?"

Given the user wants to delete a single message

and they click the gear sift and open the text box "Permanently Delete Message"

When the user clicks "Yes"

Then the message should be deleted from the conversation for them as well as any other participants of that conversation.
item.summary: Web Clinical Portal: Delete single message

item.title: [BW-10921] Patient visibility limits by facilities using same clinical portal
item.description:
As a telehealth coordinator, I want to ensure that access to patient data is controlled at each facility without creating a clinical portal for each facility so that I don't have multiple clinical portals to manage (and pay for) when I am using the same provider network/workflow.

  • In order to limit the view of patients by facility, we need to associate a patient record to a facility. Then we can set up new permissions so that we control which facilities a provider (or other user) should be able to access the patient data.
  • Need an unassigned category for new patients who are added without a category
    • Unassigned patients MUST be viewable by everyone with access to the clinical portal to prevent the patient record from being lost.
    • Once a patient record has a facility associated, then they will be filtered by that facility
  • Patient to Facility is a 1:many relationship since a patient may visit both Hub and Spoke sites or even multiple spoke sites
    • If a spoke site doesn't have visibility to a patient that is at another spoke, they will add a new patient. We expect this to create duplicate patient files in our system.

Create a new set of site permissions that will trickle down to Case and Patient Permissions.

  • Facility Permissions do not need to be set up. If they are NOT set up, then visibility will be global for the clinical portal except where permissions are created for Case and Patient.
  • When Facility Permissions are set up, they will dictate whether users can see patients across a facility and so must be set up for every user.
  • Facilities are set up in Enterprise today. These should display as options for setting up Facility Privileges in the clinical portal. As case permissions shows clinical modules today.
    • There is one level to set permissions for facility.
    • Facility permissions may be set up by Role or User Group.
    • User Groups must be set up in Enterprise. Examples for Facility user groups may be all Admins, all neurologists, providers at Facility A, Providers at facility B, Admin at facility B... etc

Acceptance Criteria:

  • Reports should only have data visible in the report based on the users’ permission.
    • Admin user with permission to HUB and Spoke sites should pull a report that has patient data for all facilities they are associated with.
    • Set up would be Facility A (HUB) has a user group and is given access to the spoke sites: Facility B and Facility C.
      • Facility B user group will ONLY be given access to Facility B. Facility C user group will only be given access to Facility C.
      • User at Facility B who is set up with access ONLY for Facility B should only see patient data/case data for Facility B.
  • Facilities set up in a clinical portal should be visible as headings within the Facility Privileges similar to how Clinical Modules appear under Case Permissions.
  • Implementation manager should be able to set up user groups that are visible for selection under Facility Privileges. Examples for a Hub and spoke Telestroke may be HUB Neurologists, Facility B ED providers, and Facility C ED providers.
  • A provider set up to only see patients on Facility B should NOT be able to receive notifications for cases at Facility C.
  • A provider set up for Facility B should NOT be able to be on schedule for Facility C. The scheduler should see that there is a scheduling gap for Facility C.
  • If a nurse/provider has permission for Facility C and they do a patient search, they should not see patients at Facility A and B.
  • If a nurse/provider views the All Cases page, they should only see cases associated with patients for the same facility where they are permissioned.
  • Nurses can do a patient search and create a case if they find the patient. If they do not find the patient, they can add the patient and then create the case. If the patient was already at Facility C but the nurse does not have permissions for Facility C, then the patient may end up with separate records at Facility A (where the nurse is creating a new case) and Facility C.
  • Nurses can create an appointment either by searching for a patient or creating a new patient. Similar to creating a case, a nurse can only see patients for the facilities where the nurse has permissions.
item.summary: Patient visibility limits by facilities using same clinical portal

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment: Facility Privileging.pptx

Kevin EckhartLindsey Cornwell Dylan Marks
We have observed there are already patient and case permissions available on clinical portal
Does facility permission replace existing case/patient permissions ? Or do we need both permissions(clinical module and facility)

Sharjeel Ahmed

The facility permissions would sit above Case or Patient permissions. So that if the facility permissions are set up and so are the case and patient, look to Facility first and then further segment a user's permission by the Case/Patient permissions. Kevin attached the slide presentation and this is the first slide.

Lindsey Cornwell Dylan Marks We had following concerns, please confirm:

  1. Will the patient be able to add facility in their profile or only provider can associate a facility with patient's profile?
  2. While scheduling a provider there is no option for facility selection, how should we restrict providers from being scheduled across facilities in this case?
  3. "If a spoke site doesn't have visibility to a patient that is at another spoke, they will add a new patient. We expect this to create duplicate patient files in our system." As a part of BW-10991 FUNCTIONAL REVIEW we are restricting duplicate patient creation in our system.
  4. Following areas are not mentioned in acceptance criteria, please confirm if we need to cater them too as a part of this ticket on clinical portal?
  • Patient Search
  • View all cases
  • Create case
  • Create appointment

FYI, Asad Zubair Sharjeel Ahmed

1. Will the patient be able to add facility in their profile or only provider can associate a facility with patient's profile? No. This should be added when the case comes in. If DTC the patient should be either associated with a facility based on the clinical portal or come in without a facility.
  2. While scheduling a provider there is no option for facility selection, how should we restrict providers from being scheduled across facilities in this case? Where is this happening? I'll have to do some digging and get back to you.
  3. "If a spoke site doesn't have visibility to a patient that is at another spoke, they will add a new patient. We expect this to create duplicate patient files in our system." As a part of BW-10991 FUNCTIONAL REVIEW DEV QA we are restricting duplicate patient creation in our system. I'll chat with Dylan Marks and get back to you.
  4. Following areas are not mentioned in acceptance criteria, please confirm if we need to cater them too as a part of this ticket on clinical portal?
  • Patient Search Yes, I will update the AC
  • View all cases Yes, I will update the AC
  • Create case Nurses can create cases for a patient in front of them sharing their information. They can't search for that existing patient if they were not permissioned for the facility where the patient has been in the past.
  • Create appointment Same as create case

Fatima Danish
I was able to talk to Dylan Marks and we are okay with #3 being different for each story. BW-10991 FUNCTIONAL REVIEW should not limit the entire system from having duplicates. We won't turn on the facility privileging for each site so we will work with our customers to make sure they understand the risk of creating duplicate patient accounts before turning on this feature.

Thank you!
Lindsey

Lindsey Cornwell Dylan Marks we had more concerns on following:
In order to limit the view of patients by facility, we need to associate a patient record to a facility. How are we going to achieve this? Can you explain the expected flow for this please?

What we understand out of No. This should be added when the case comes in. If DTC the patient should be either associated with a facility based on the clinical portal or come in without a facility. is we should bind the patient record with the facility when case is created. If a patient has multiple cases with different facilities, in that case that patient will be associated with all those facilities.

FYI, Sharjeel Ahmed Ziauddin Asad Zubair

Lindsey Cornwell Dylan Marks
Any update on this ?
Could you review the scope is written in BW-9762 Development and let us know if that would address the need to track patient/facility mapping?

Basically, this story 10921 doesn’t really cover the way we will track the relationship between patients and facilities. BW‌-9762 has completed scope for that which we have hashed out over a few calls a couple months ago. This includes using a table that links patients to a ‘care team’ that for now can only be facilities. I recommend a separate table that explicitly creates these links, rather than look at appt and case history on the fly. This makes it easier to debug and track and gives better performance. This is some learning we developed through multiple iterations in v7 that we can leverage.
Dylan Marks Thanks for clarification. We are working on patient to facility binding as mentioned in BW‌-9762
Sharjeel Ahmed Any update on this ticket?

item.title: [BW-11366] Web Clinical: Remove "Leave Group" for 1:1 Conversations
item.description:
As a Nurse using the Web application and participating in a 1:1 conversation, I'm confused when I go to message that person and receive a lot of errors because they left the "group." I'd like the option to leave group be removed for 1:1 conversations so that this confusion is avoided.

Right now on mobile, the option to "Leave group" only appears for group messages: not 1:1. However the web displays this option. If a user leaves the "group" in a 1:1 conversation, the other user can't use the same message thread and gets all sorts of weird errors when trying. Please update this function to ONLY display when users are in a group message.

Given that I'm in a 1:1 conversation in messaging

When I look at the options for the message under the gear shift

Then I should NOT see an option to "leave group."

Given that I'm in a group conversation

When I look at the options for the message under the gear shift

Then I should see an option to "leave group."
item.summary: Web Clinical: Remove "Leave Group" for 1:1 Conversations

item.title: [BW-11344] Dignity: Email to Admin for Access Requests
item.description:
"As a Clinical Portal Admin, I need to be notified via email when a new request for access to the clinical portal has been submitted."

Background:
When "Allow clinical users to request access to clinical portal" is enabled (client-enterprise - clinical portal - settings), anyone in the Admin role for that portal will receive a web notification. The issue is that the Admin will only see this notification if he or she is logged into the portal. This is important for granting access to non-DH providers.

Request:
As a near-term solution with low LOE, can we automatically send an email to all portal admins when a new access request is submitted? That email could say the same thing as the web-based notification but it also needs to include the Clinical Portal link. "Jane Smith with email jane.smith@example.org has requested access for Portal Name. Please navigate to insert clinical portal link to approve or reject."
item.summary: Dignity: Email to Admin for Access Requests

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

Avizia has changed their ADFS certificate, we can get the latest one from

https://sso.avizia.com/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml.

Here’s the latest one for reference:

Verified the fix on dt for patient portal and clinical portal

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

item.title: [BW-10399] SAML SSO Configuration Improvements for Dignity
item.description:
Avizia's ADFS does not currently allow setting up single sign on with multiple sites.

SSO (SAML) on clinical portals: we are working on setting up Dignity Health which will have 40 sites that need ADFS enabled. Trying to figure out whether we only need one relying party in ADFS or 40. I would say only one since we use that redirect thing to tell ADFS where they came from after auth happens to redirect back to the right portal. However, DH wants to control what user gets access to what site using ADFS Claims rules.

The problem is that all sites use one-sites-prod as the ID. So it’s not possible to setup another RP from the same ADFS.

BREAKING CHANGES:
In order to implement these changes, we need to reach out to all of our existing SAML SSO customers to get them to update their end point in ADFS configuration. Perhaps we should use this as an opportunity to do automatic certificate swapping as a way to explain why we are making everyone change their ADFS.
item.summary: SAML SSO Configuration Improvements for Dignity

comments.comment: Julie Henderson we need to track this for Dignity Health to get their SSO working across 40 sites.

One question we should gut check here: will these changes require us to make Clinical Mobile app changes?

How about the Patient Portal SAML story as well: BW-9259 Shipped

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: SAML SSO Configuration Improvements for Dignity

item.title: [BW-11469] UNC: Patient portal - hide patient demographics with portal setting
item.description:
Client Issue:
UNC is using context aware linking SSO from MyChart into the Avizia Patient Portal. They do not want patient's to add/update or enter any demographic information in Avizia.

This is also critical to Parkland + Northwell.

Solution:

  1. Add enterprise Patient Portal Setting to hide demographics on the patient portal. Should not prompt them to fill this out on first login. Username, or other demographics that is missing from the patient portal should not push them to fill it out.
    1. Setting should be 'Show demographics form'
  2. This should not impact the Intake Current Address functionality. This should still prompt if enabled. Typically the patient address is getting populated from the interface (in terms of Northwell) and thus would be preloaded in the Current Address by default (and editable there). Asking the demographics on login is redundant for this reason.
  3. Demographics form should be hidden completely including within the top nav.

OUT OF SCOPE:

  1. Not making this change on the myCare app at this time. Both of the customers needing this (UNC + Parkland) will be using webrtc within iOS safari.
item.summary: UNC: Patient portal - hide patient demographics with portal setting

comments.comment: This would also be valuable for Northwell and may allow us to skip BW‌-8032. Aaron Harris
This was requested again by Northwell on a call today in context of the Appt checkin interface.

We noticed when testing at Parkland, that the demographics show up every single time for the patient, even if the patient has logged into the patient portal before and confirmed the information. It also defaults back to the demographics page after the case has been completed by the Provider and won't let the user navigate to any other part of the site until confirming all of this information again.
ayman@avizia.com i’m moving this up the priority list in the WAWD and would like to review this tomorrow

Kevin Eckhart Please confirm the following understanding:

  1. Add a setting on enterprise for the patient portal to hide demographics labelled ‘Hide demographics on login’.
  2. On patient portal login, check if the setting on point # 1 is enabled and bypass the demographics page.
  3. On patient portal, hide the Profile tab from header if the setting on point # 1 is enabled.
  4. The Intake Current Address functionality should continue to work as is.
Ibad Baig yes- this scope you listed above is correct.

Perhaps the setting name should be different as what Ibad Baig listed is to hide the demographics form completely rather than only on first load. Gut checking that... do we want to completely disable demographics? I think we do for these customers but wondering if there would be surprise issues such as inability to reset passwords. For Epic MyChart customers, they shouldn’t need their v10 password but still want to be sure we aren’t missing something. Kevin Eckhart

Let's call the setting in patient portal 'Show demographics form'. I'm still on the fence on whether we allow editing demographics at all if this setting is on. At this point I would advocate hiding demographics form completely, including in the menu and when logging in. If a patient portal has this setting we are assuming that the patient edits their demographics in Epic MyChart and we shouldn't be doing this in v10. We need to watch out for the fact that some data may not be received from us in the context link though and whether that causes problems.

item.title: [BW-11364] Web Clinical Portal: Create option to hide conversation
item.description:
As a nurse on Dignity using the messaging app, I need an easy and clear way to remove inactive conversations from my view without deleting the conversation history so that I have a shorter list of active messages to scroll through but don’t lose the history of previous conversations.

A Nurse or other users at Dignity may have hundreds of active conversations in their left sidebar. They don't necessarily want to lose the history of these on-going conversations but they need a way to focus on the active conversations that matter for their current shift.  Currently, there are options to Delete Conversation or Archive Message but these do not meet the user's needs. We would like to remove both of these existing options. 

Create a new option to "Hide Conversation" that will allow the user to remove the conversation from the left sidebar. The user may return to that conversation by going to the "new message" option and selecting that same user. When the active message window opens, the user will be able to see the history of their previous messages as well as add a new message. 

For group conversations, the Nurse may still hide these conversations. In order to pull up an old group conversation, the nurse can type the names of a few of the people involved and the app should autofill and offer previous conversations with the name of the conversation so the user could choose that. Right now, the user should not be able to open multiple conversations with the same group. For example, If I have a conversation with Dylan and Julie and I hide it, the next time I create a conversation with Dylan and Julie it should open up our old conversation. I can't have multiple conversations with Dylan and Julie. 

Remove option to "Archive Conversation" 

Remove option to "Delete Conversation"

Create new option to "Hide Conversation"

Given that a nurse has an open 1:1 conversation in their left sidebar

and the nurse would like to hide the conversation because it isn't currently active or top of mind

When the nurse clicks on the gear within the conversation in the left sidebar

and selects "Hide Conversation"

and a modal appears titled "Hide Conversation"

and asks "Would you like to hide this conversation for now?"

and the user selects "Yes"

Then the conversation should no loner appear in their left sidebar

and the Nurse can return to the message by opening a new message with that same user

and see the thread of their previous messages.

Given that a nurse has an open group conversation in their left sidebar

and the nurse would like to hide the conversation because it isn't currently active or top of mind

When the nurse clicks on the gear within the conversation in the left sidebar

and selects "Hide Conversation"

and a modal appears titled "Hide Conversation"

and asks "Would you like to hide this conversation for now?"

and the user selects "Yes"

Then the conversation should no loner appear in their left sidebar

and the Nurse can return to the message by opening a new message and adding the same users

and see the thread of their previous messages.
item.summary: Web Clinical Portal: Create option to hide conversation

item.title: [BW-9957] Clinical Portal: Display the list of editors on a case by form
item.description:
As a Coordinator for the Telehealth program I need to easily see who has worked on each element within the case so I can coordinate with providers and share the information to auditors.

Scope:

Today the Header Panel Area shows who last edited each individual form on a case. We also need a way for the user to click to view the edit history of each form.


  1. Case Details (clinical web) - On the header of each case, have a scrollable modal dialog that opens up details of who edited a case. See Rach's design page for an example of the scrollable modal dialog: https://design.avizia.io/clinical-desktop/components/preview/des-portal-c-dialogs.html The list of edits might include:
    1. Added <date> at <time> by <name>.
    2. Edited <date> at <time> by <name> <timestamp>.
    3. Signed <date> at <time> by <name> <timestamp>.
    4. Verified and completed <date> at <time> by <name> <timestamp>

Acceptance Criteria

  1. When a user clicks the scrollable modal dialog, a view of actions and editors should appear in a list from most recent to oldest.
  2. The first editor should be listed as a "added": "Added <date> at <time> by <name>"
  3. Following edits should be listed as "Edited <date> at <time> by <name>"
  4. If the editor signed the form, that should be listed as "Signed <date> at <time> by <name>"
  5. The user should be able to close out of the list using a standard X in the right upper corner or by clicking the button against to toggle the sliding panel closed.

item.title: [BW-7700] On Call Schedule (Monthly and List - View and Print) - "Advanced Print Options"
item.description:
As a nurse at a Dignity facility, I need to easily view who is on the schedule and customize the view I want to print so that the print out is useful, doesn't print too many pages, and has only the information I need printed at my station.

  1. When a user is on the view for MONTH view for a specific clinical module and they choose to print, display a modal that allows the user to select the event data they want included on the calendar.There is a lot that we could show so users need to be able to deselect what they don’t need so the view out is less busy.
    1. Display check boxes that a user may select and deselct for each of the following: Provider Name (FN, LN), Credentials, Priority, Primary and Secondary On Call Contact Methods, Shift date/time (am/pm format)
    2. Display a button for the user to click "Cancel" which closes the modal.
    3. Once the user has made their selections, they will click print. This will pull up the existing print preview window where the user can select their printer.
    4. A user may choose to go back from the print preview and change their selections on the previous modal. If they click "cancel" on this modal, the modal will close and they will have to start over.
  2. Dignity providers may have 24 hour shifts that start one day and end the next. When they view these shifts, they do not want to see overlap on the monthly version of the calendar from yesterday’s shift display on the next day's view. The reason is that it overcomplicates the view of the Monthly calendar.
    1. For example: if a shift begins each day at 7am and ends the next day at 7am, my view for each day should be:
    2. Viewing the calendar for Monday I will see the shift beginning Monday at 7am. I will not see Sunday's shift spilling over into Monday. If the time is listed for Monday's shift, I will see it as 7am -7am.
    3. Viewing Tuesday, I should see the shift that begins on Tuesday at 7am but I will NOT see Monday's shift spilling over into the Tuesday.
    4. Viewing Wednesday, I should see the shift that begins on Wednesday at 7am but NOT see Tuesday's shift spilling into Wednesday even though it ends Wednesday at 7am.
    5. This should appear for the Web and Print view.
    6. Said another way: If the shift is divisible by 24hrs then these are considered all day shifts and you would show the provider name for that day only and not show the provider on call the next day for the overlap hours in the morning of the next day.
  3. If shift is less than 24-hours, show all providers on-call that day (example: Show 12am-8am, 8am-5pm, 5pm-11:59pm)
item.summary: On Call Schedule (Monthly and List - View and Print) - "Advanced Print Options"

item.title: [BW-11606] Integration: PDF and RTF timestamps should render based on facility time zone
item.description:
Documentation timestamps on both the RTF and PDF forms that were sent via the Gateway currently appear as UTC in EHRs such as Epic. However they are appearing as EST in v10. The should appear as the right time zone for the document sent over the interface.

Potential patient safety issue - users see incorrect timestamps on documentation in EMR and could make clinical decisions according to incorrect time. System is being used in the Emergency Department - high stress environment where users are need to make decisions and act quickly

When rendering a PDF/RTF via the API to send via Gateway, it does not have a local web browser time zone to automatically detect, and so we need a setting adding to the Facility to keep track of this.

  1. When rendering a PDF in the browser, continue to use the local computer clock.
  2. When rendering a PDF/RTF via the API to send via Gateway, it does not have a local web browser time zone to automatically detect, and so we need a setting. In Facility settings, add a setting for Facility Time Zone. Should default to ET to support legacy customers.
  3. When rendering the PDF/RTF this needs to be the time zone of the facility linked to this case. Timestamps should always include displaying the time zone to make it clear to the user: Eg Jan 2, 2019 23:40 ET.
item.summary: Integration: PDF and RTF timestamps should render based on facility time zone

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: Dylan Marks are you tracking this under another ticket?
Kevin Eckhart Dylan Marks accidentally assigned this ticket to myself, please reassign appropriately. Thanks & sorry!
Updated the scope to include the need for the concept of a Facility.TimeZone.

Dylan Marks what should be the input for the timezone here that we put on the UI?
My suggestion is that we put a UTC offset here, so that the user can put down the offset and we calculate it, rather than having huge list of strings? What do you suggest?

Just showing the timezone offset is the ‘best’ way of rendering, but it’s not user friendly. Most people don’t think in terms of “I’m in UTC -5”. They say “I’m in Eastern”. So we should render it with “ET” or “MT” or “PT” etc.

Is there not a code library that you can use to look up the 2-3 character time zones with a drop list? Seems to me like this would be a rather common thing. eg https://momentjs.com/timezone/docs/#/zone-object/
https://www.npmjs.com/package/timezone-list

As we work on this, let’s keep our eye on avoiding bugs with Daylight Savings Time. That has been a painful thing we’ve had to deal with in the past. So when we render a particular timestamp, we need to make sure we are rendering it with the correct time zone offset for when that time actually happened. Eg if a case happened at 1:50 am on Sunday Nov 4, and wasn’t signed until 2:30am on Nov 4, we should properly handle the time zone rendering for each of those timestamps as it crosses the DST flip.

Dylan Marks the timezone data used in the ticket is

https://github.com/dmfilipenko/timezones.json/blob/master/timezones.json

Dylan Marks I have a few suggestions;

  1. As the timezone list is huge, a simple drop-down can’t cover the best User Experience, therefore, it can be made into a drop-down search, for user to search from all the available list.
  2. The timezone list can be displayed like *(UTC‌-05:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada) America/New York* some what similar to Windows Timezone list.

Please review the suggestions

I have concerns with that list as it includes both standard and daylight times. That implies we won’t automatically adjust time based on Daylight savings time rollback/forward twice a year. Need to figure out how we will handle that. BTW this was the source of a huge amount of dev effort in v7 and a lot of bugs that I would love to sidestep somehow.

Dylan Marks the list can be filtered and structured to achieve your requirements criteria, so for example the Daylight savings will be removed from the list and so on. The actual reason to use the provided timezone list is that it provides essential information for date parsing, like abbreviation, offset, regions etc.

Furthermore, the thing ‘bout handling the DST, can be done with the already integrated time library in our application, so that-based on the user’s region, the library will automatically adjust the time. For example, If a case was created at 1:30 AM of Nov 4th, 2018 (which lies inside the DST frame), then after crossing 2:00 AM of Nov 4th, 2018, the case will still display 1:30 AM of DST, instead of 2:30 AM (+1 hr), and any cases created after 2:00 AM of Nov 4th, 2018, will be back to the normal timezone. Same case will be repeated automatically for further years to come.
In v7 we stored the date time of DST switch in our own dB table and thus was a support overhead as the specific times changed year to year. Will we encounter the same issue?

Dylan Marks No we will not encounter the same issue, because the DateTime library handles the DST shifts automatically, provided, if the proper region is set, for example America/New York. It will work for more years to come.

  1. Can you please suggest the format the Timezone should be displayed to user in the drop-down (I will remove any DST timezone from the list I provided) ?
  2. Should a search be implemented for user to search for timezone, or a simple drop-down will suffice ? Please suggest.

item.title: [BW-10613] Integration: Send attachments to EHR with separate Media messages
item.description:
As a provider, I would like all the attachments - such as photos of a wound captured with an examcam - to be sent to my EHR as part of the completed note documentation. This can be sent via an HL7 message through Redox.

  1. Send additional separate Media messages for each attachment on the case
    1. Upload the file to Redox blob server first (same as PDF)
    2. DocumentID should be in the format "northwelldemo-Case1234-photo-of-myhand.jpg"
    3. Media.FileTypeString needs to take the file type of the attachment (after the last dot).
    4. We can use the Media FHIR API. https://www.hl7.org/fhir/media.html
      1. In order to retrieve the list of attachments for a case, call the media api with context = EncounterID.
      2. For this version, we would implement the Media Read only. In the future we will also want Write (ability to add attachments to a case from the API) but out of scope for now.
item.summary: Integration: Send attachments to EHR with separate Media messages

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: Aaron Harris for you to track the Northwell request of sending all attachments to their VNA. This would also work to route attachments to Epic / Hyland OnBase etc.

Dylan Marks
I’ve added the base64 encoding for the attachments of the case aswell.
They are represented in the format as “enterpriseId--caseGUID--IMG“
the image identifiers are GUIDs as well hence we can’t attach those too. Doing so will take us back to the long title problem. What do you suggest?

Heres an example title for an image in the Media message.
avizia--52adb120-b166-4b46-9101-fb420c87c523--IMG

Let’s use caseNumber instead of caseGUID so that it is shorter. Then instead of ‘IMG’ we should the filename of that image to make it unique for that case. The risk is the file name is longer than 20 characters, but that’s hard to avoid and I think there’s value in maintaining the file name in case it has valuable clinical information in it.
Epic OnBase may not have that same rule with 20 chars max and I can't see how we could avoid using the filename.
