item.title: [BW-12090] Epic SSO: Appointment check in from context link should not be automatic
item.description:
As a provider I would like to click through from Epic and land on the case in American Well case that was sent from the HL7 interface. When I do that, I don’t want to automatically check in the associated appointment. If I’m a provider, I want to make sure that the referring site/ patient is the one that does that check in event, so that i get notified and can see when the patient is ready for the video.

We previously worked on these requirements in BW‌-9477 - requirement #1 - but still not working as expected. We extracted the primary requirement below and added clarification.

Creating the case from context link should find the existing appointment, create a related case, but leave the appointment status as pending rather than automatically set it as checked in.

Related: BW‌-9725 - this will allow the provider to sit in Avizia on the case and see the status change of the appointment so they know when the patient is ready.

  1. Appointment sent from HL7. Has a VisitID. The patient will check in within Avizia. At the same time the provider will click through from that appointment into Avizia with context link. We should make sure that they don’t end up on different cases.
    1. Create the case based on the appointment, but leave the appointment in the Booked status instead of ‘Arrived’ status.
    2. As a provider, I want to click through from Epic and sit on the case, waiting for the patient to be ready and checked in. When the patient checks in, the status of the appointment should change and anyone on the case details should get an update.
    3. Also create this same Jira for the SMART on FHIR flow to act the same way.

This functionality is focused on Epic right now, but all the logic should work just the same for SMART on FHIR or other authentication approaches.
item.summary: Epic SSO: Appointment check in from context link should not be automatic

comments.comment: FYI....Calista JohnsonLauren KokernakAaron Harris

All of the flows mention in this ticket are covered in BW‌-10982 (which is in code review status from last month). once it finalized from code review we will schedule for any upcoming release.

item.title: [BW-10554] Appointment self schedule page > Only show info section when there is enough data, otherwise dont.
item.description:
Go to enterprise

item.title: [BW-4489] Notify myCare patient 15 minutes before the scheduled appointment by sending Push
item.description:
To notify user we require sending Push to the user.
Assuming that Blackwell should check if the user is mobile user.

On MyCare side (old Urbani API) we have used the following DATA and Notify Type:
Type: upcoming_appointment

data: {
        "appointment_link_id": 1234567, // int
        "start_date": 1234567 // timestamp
        "service_line": "serviceline" // string
        "duration": 40 // int, in minutes
}

So, fill request will be with following structure:
Call
/notify/v1/patient/send (with Server HMAC)
Data:

{
    "message": "Name of Notification",
    "message_text": "Additional text to display",
    "type": "upcoming_appointment", 
    "user_id" : "30ba3908-f817-46f9-a509-3887f658201b", // Existing Patient ID
    "data": {
       "appointment_link_id": 1234567, // int
        "start_date": 1234567 // timestamp
        "service_line": "serviceline_name" // string
        "duration": 40 // int, in minutes
    }
}
item.summary: Notify myCare patient 15 minutes before the scheduled appointment by sending Push

comments.comment: Tuan DoAnand DwivediAlex Prihodko - We are adding in the ability to send appointment reminders to both clinical and patient users on web with this story in 10.7 release - BW-4075 Shipped . This allows the customers to configure WHEN it should be sent and WHAT the text is. We should build the API around this so it can be pulled into myCare as well.

Poojitha Dontu Anand Dwivedi Tuan Do
Should it affect myCare behavior? Currently we show appointment on Dashboard 15 minutes before, and keep it on screen 30 minutes after (hardcoded values). are you saying that those values should be pulled from the API?
Can you please describe in which way myCare functionality should be modified?

Alex Prihodko,
The appointment should be available for Check-in 15 minutes before the scheduled time, through 30 minutes after the scheduled time. In essence, this creates a 45 minute window during which the appointment can be checked into.

The reminder functionality in BW-4075 Shipped allows configuration on when a reminder is sent out for the scheduled appointment, and shouldn't affect the Check-in parameters.

My question is if we should have a reminder go out when an appointment is available for Check-in (15 mins before schedule time), or if we'll just have that be the default setting for BW-4075 Shipped , and allow it to be configured per that story.

Poojitha Dontu, Tuan Do - feel free to chime in so we're all on the same page.
This can go out separately from the BW-4568 Shipped epic.
Anand Dwivedi I took this out of the epic, so I can close it. I've assigned it to you, so you can prioritize it in the backlog.

I think this could be closed out. The Appointment reminder functionality should be sufficient. I think the one difference is that reminder functionality does not send push messages via the app, it only sends SMS messages. Eventually I think we should reproduce this story which is to send messages by app push rather than SMS if we know the patient has an active account. PHX-4175 Done
Anand Dwivedi

Dylan Marks
That what we, in fact expect after implementing this task.
We should just send sms and push together, since there is no guarantee the user has the mobile app installed.

sajidbarkaat.10p Alex Prihodko
https://one-sites-tpc.avizia.com
Code: clinic
blackwell-testing@yopmail.com Avizia@2018

Menu - More - Appointments - General Consult - Any Provider - Create Appointment for patient Alex Willson

myCare (patient app)
Clinic code: 5678
Patient blackwell-testing@yopmail.com Avizia@2018
Wait 15 minutes before time
Expected result: incoming push notification
Actual result: nothing

Hi Vacheslav Bashtinskyj

This is a configurable feature. One needs to configure a reminder from Enterprise Portal before receiving it.

This particular feature is available at
Enterprise Management > Workflows (E.g. General Consult) > Appointment Reminder > Add Appointment

  1. Select Recipient as Patient
  2. Enter Notification time in hour(s)
  3. Select Template as Patient Appointment Reminder

For your convenience I've configured a reminder for General Consult. Let me know if you still faces same issue.

Regards

Hi Priyank Maiya

Can you please confirm if a timer service exists for TPC environment. Because this ticket depends on timer service to hit a Clinical Portal web hook.

Regards

Hi Vacheslav Bashtinskyj

Please do not continue testing this ticket on TPC. It's not confirmed if Timer Service is working on TPC. Instead I will deploy this ticket on dev environment and check if it is working there.

I will let you know when its ready for testing.

Regards
FYI Alex Prihodko Asad Zubair

sajidbarkaat.10p
Ok. Thank you. I return this ticket to you. Change its status when everything is ready.

Hi Priyank Maiya

This ticket is deployed on TPC and it requires Timer service. It seems Timer service is not configured with TPC or any dev environment.

Once an appointment reminder is created and an appointment is being created it gives an error. The error details are as follows. 

{"error""name":"StatusCodeError","statusCode":502,"message":"502 - \"\\r\\n502 Bad Gateway\\r\\n\\r\\n502 Bad Gateway\\r\\nnginx/1.10.3 (Ubuntu)\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\n\"","error":"\r\n502 Bad Gateway\r\n\r\n502 Bad Gateway\r\nnginx/1.10.3 (Ubuntu)\r\n\r\n\r\n","options""method":"POST","url":"https://timer-api-dev.avizia.com/v1/schedule","headers""content-type":"application/json","Authorization":"Credential=timer_dev_0917, Window=1526296144258, Signature=ab6dfa3ac46072afd7bb90f8983a8d909d713c7e03cbb01657577e2bc899c12a"},"body""tag":"65ae7109-3eb8-43b8-8f8b-1b00ea70f638","schedule_at":1526477580000,"ignore_after":1526497140000,"callback":"\r\n502">https://one-sites-devtp06.avizia.com/api/workflow/appointment_reminder/avizia-id/0163322c-f136-4b9e-9a5e-20eebf723e4b/557e61ce-af7c-4a92-8626-16522891c2da","headers""enterprise_id":"avizia-id"}},"json":true,"simple":true,"resolveWithFullResponse":false,"transform2xxOnly":false},"response""statusCode":502,"body":"<html>\r\n<head><title>502</a> Bad Gateway\r\n\r\n502 Bad Gateway\r\nnginx/1.10.3 (Ubuntu)\r\n\r\n\r\n","headers""server":"nginx/1.10.3 (Ubuntu)","date":"Mon, 14 May 2018 11:09:04 GMT","content-type":"text/html","content-length":"182","connection":"close"},"request""uri""protocol":"https:","slashes":true,"auth":null,"host":"timer-api-dev.avizia.com","port":443,"hostname":"timer-api-dev.avizia.com","hash":null,"search":null,"query":null,"pathname":"/v1/schedule","path":"/v1/schedule","href":"https://timer-api-dev.avizia.com/v1/schedule"},"method":"POST","headers""content-type":"application/json","Authorization":"Credential=timer_dev_0917, Window=1526296144258, Signature=ab6dfa3ac46072afd7bb90f8983a8d909d713c7e03cbb01657577e2bc899c12a","accept":"application/json","content-length":311}}}}}

item.title: [BW-10585] Epic SSO: Security concern - patient SSO links shouldn't work with clinical portals
item.description:
We shouldn't be able to use the same encrypted string for both patients and providers and it works.

The risk: a patient clicks the MyChart link into their url, but then take that same string, and switch to the clinical portal and come in as a clinical user.

See the original scope in BW-8462 Shipped
"In the querystring vars below, the role would be '2' (patient) and I don't think the user info would be passed (only patient info)."

For backwards compatibility, if role is not passed in the query string, don't enforce it. We don't want to break Fairview and MUSC when we release this. 

PATIENTOPENURL: (Clinical Portal - Provider/Staff)    visitID=%CSN%&userID=%SYSLOGIN%&provID=%USERPROVID%&userFName=%USERFNAME%&userLName=%USERLNAME%&npiID=%USERPROVNPI%&patID=%PATID%&mychartID=%WPRID%&mrn=%PATID%&patFName=%FNAME%&patLName=%LNAME%&DOB=%DOB%&timestamp=%TIMESTAMP%&departmentID=%ENCDEPID%&department=%ENCFACNPINAME%&visittype=%VISITTYPE%&workstationID=%WORKSTATIONID%&role=1


PATIENTOPENURL:  (Patient Portal - Patient Role)    visitID=%CSN%&userID=%SYSLOGIN%&provID=%USERPROVID%&userFName=%USERFNAME%&userLName=%USERLNAME%&npiID=%USERPROVNPI%&patID=%PATID%&mychartID=%WPRID%&mrn=%PATID%&patFName=%FNAME%&patLName=%LNAME%&DOB=%DOB%&timestamp=%TIMESTAMP%&departmentID=%ENCDEPID%&department=%ENCFACNPINAME%&visittype=%VISITTYPE%&workstationID=%WORKSTATIONID%&role=2

https://parklandconnect-stg.avizia.com/SSO/Epic/?data=oSi%2B48Nz3hExpb7dnuNiU4u3YGKwGssVU4eECI36ChOPVjmtY0pfW2E0l6qYVfTXrhuNN0o%2Bm1oAWzrW8bRkZttb4CHpZ0CskUAU59qz3cDX75L8BZYg3IbYrbPh2qc7WdTBVw26CsDRlH8M32yIQcdHPBz2CgqEHtXqyXMvWA%2Ba0G%2BzVp8qT48x%2Fgz1iBRTAFz2lFfKlway4u5IEf17JfS%2F9g73xXKdtFn9bchHK9YpZEu4mBdMvI823N1EvC1JVujCnu3PTylfXIHeHpKuvw%3D%3D

https://parkland-stg.avizia.com/SSO/Epic/?data=oSi%2B48Nz3hExpb7dnuNiU4u3YGKwGssVU4eECI36ChOPVjmtY0pfW2E0l6qYVfTXrhuNN0o%2Bm1oAWzrW8bRkZttb4CHpZ0CskUAU59qz3cDX75L8BZYg3IbYrbPh2qc7WdTBVw26CsDRlH8M32yIQcdHPBz2CgqEHtXqyXMvWA%2Ba0G%2BzVp8qT48x%2Fgz1iBRTAFz2lFfKlway4u5IEf17JfS%2F9g73xXKdtFn9bchHK9YpZEu4mBdMvI823N1EvC1JVujCnu3PTylfXIHeHpKuvw%3D%3D
item.summary: Epic SSO: Security concern - patient SSO links shouldn't work with clinical portals

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment: This remains a priority. Parkland will be the first MyChart SSO customer which increases the visibility of this security hole. As a reminder you could simply tweak the domain to point at the clinical portal and a patient could log in as a provider and see private health info.

Dylan Marks

When a patient clicks the SSO link, should we expect it to bring in provider information as well?

#If the link doesn't contain provider data, and patient switches from 'patients' to 'sites' in the URL, error message would be displayed: "User details are missing in input data"

#If the patient portal encryption link comes in with provider information as well, we can handle it by adding two separate encryption keys for patient portal and provider portal on the EMR settings in Enterprise. If the patient attempts to access clinical portal with the patient portal encryption link, error message would be displayed: "Access is denied to the portal. Please contact administrator"

Let us know if we should move forward with this implementation.
saad malik Asad Zubair

1. No, the provider info will not be on the context link when doing MyChart SSO. Just patient data. Thus it sounds like we will error out even now since we aren't passing provider info.
  2. The new role=1 parameter will control whether an encrypted link will work against the clinical portal. This is the focus of this ticket. If someone tries to send encrypted data with role=2 to a clinical portal, we should throw an error.
    1. "The request cannot be completed due to incorrect data. This link is for patient portals (role 2)."
  3. I don't think we need a separate encryption key for patient and clinical portals since the role=1 protects against this.

Example MyChart SSO from parkland:

{  
   "patient":{  
      "es_patient_id":"E3602207",
      "first_name":"Carson",
      "last_name":"WEpicTesting",
      "mrn":"E3602207",
      "emr_mychart_id":"122260",
      "role":"2",
      "date_of_birth":""
   },
   "user":{  
      "es_user_id":"",
      "emr_provider_id":"",
      "first_name":"",
      "last_name":"MYCHART",
      "npi_id":"",
      "emr_mychart_id":"122260",
      "role":"2"
   },
   "visit":{  
      "es_case_id":"930003651",
      "visit_type":"",
      "appt_time":"",
      "department":"",
      "departmentID":""
   },
   "unencrypted_data":"visitID=930003651&userID=&provID=&userFName=&userLName=MYCHART&npiID=&patID=E3602207&mychartID=122260&mrn=E3602207&patFName=Carson&patLName=WEpicTesting&DOB=8%2F27%2F1963&timestamp=20180827163310&departmentID=&department=&visittype=%VISITTYPE%&workstationID=PHHSID&role=2",
   "settings":{  
      "emr_id":"c97ff018-5e66-44c9-9657-c8398d27dd38",
      "external_system_id":"48176f66-2b8f-4539-a36c-894afd84cbf7",
      "type":"epic",
      "name":"Parkland Epic Stage",
      "ambra_gateway_id":"",
      "client_id":"",
      "target":"",
      "practice_id":"",
      "search_id_name":null,
      "search_require_dob":null,
      "search_require_first_name":null,
      "search_require_last_name":null,
      "default_workflow_id":"f84d8081-5b10-4c84-b4b5-a9a58b7bbd8e",
      "default_facility_id":"a46e038a-9cb0-4258-b3b6-60f464401735",
      "encryption_key":"Parkland-avizia-6546&1",
      "created_at":"1528225150363",
      "updated_at":"1530041333267",
      "search_enabled":false,
      "search_config":null,
      "search_demographics_request_uri":null,
      "search_visit_request_uri":null,
      "facility_id":"a46e038a-9cb0-4258-b3b6-60f464401735",
      "service_line_id":"9ebb5850-0cf0-4136-a5f7-087e9032e98c"
   }
}

Aleeza Hassan asks:

“if the query string does not come with "role" key, what should be the default role?
Currently what we've implemented is, to access clinical portal, role must be equal to 1. Patient portal would be accessible with both role = 1 and role = 2. Let us know if we want to add the layer of security on patient portal as well.”

If role is passed, then enforce the security of that role (eg only accept role 2 for patient portal and only accept role 1 for clinical portals).

If role is not passed, I’m concerned about backwards compatibility. We set up MUSC and Fairview before we added this role parameter on clinical portals. For that reason, I think for now if the role is not passed in the querystring then we don’t enforce it.

item.title: [BW-7608] Ambra: push notification not going to other people when Check for Imaging is successful
item.description:
Preconditions:
ambra should be configured at enterprise admin panel
ambra notification should be also configured for test workflow :
Trigger: ambra-imaging
User Notification Preference: Imaging Available
Recipient: provider role

Steps:
1.Assign case to Provider1Account
2.Login to web using Provider2Account
3.Go to case details and add image form
4.Tap "Check for Imaging" button -> GET request to https://one-sites-tpc.avizia.com/workflow/caselinks/M0396439/959ad42c-019e-49dd-b87a-37d7dc89de35?refresh=true

Expected:
According to notifications configuration all providers should be able to receive push notification about new Ambra Image via mobile app

Actual:
Only Provider2Account has received push notification
Provider1Account(current case assignee) does not know about new image

Alex Prihodko Tuan Do Dylan Marks Jeff Hicks
item.summary: Ambra: push notification not going to other people when Check for Imaging is successful

comments.comment:
Tuan Do Dylan Marks Jeff Hicks

I think, we would need TPC Mobile Build to reproduce this one. This https://s3.amazonaws.com/mobile1builds/index.html doesn't have it. We tried to reproduce it on `stg` environment but some error is occurring while assigning the case to a provider.

Asad Zubair

Saqib Ahmed links for mobile builds:
http://s3.amazonaws.com/mobile1builds/xavier-ios/dev/index.html
http://s3.amazonaws.com/mobile1builds/xavier-android/dev/index.html

http://s3.amazonaws.com/mobile1builds/xavier-android/staging/index.html
http://s3.amazonaws.com/mobile1builds/xavier-ios/staging/index.html

Actually STG env not working about 2 weeks, one - API is broken at STG servers.
If you want to reproduce this issue you can configure all Preconditions\requirements at dev ENV.

Andrew

We tried to reproduce it on `dev` environment and we are not getting any notification even on web after clicking `Check for Imaging`, while imaging is being shown and working fine. However imaging is not appearing on mobile app when we try to refresh imaging, so heres the real issue I think. I might be missing some notification settings, if you have done some notification settings, please let me know.

Asad Zubair

Saqib Ahmed mobile "refresh" button refreshes available Studies list for certain case, if Studies list was returned by server. so if in your case "imaging is not appearing on mobile app when we try to refresh imaging" - mobile app didn't received any notifications about available Studies list

Have you configured ambra service for dev env? and do not forget about notifications configuration, as I mentioned at description:
ambra should be configured at enterprise admin panel
ambra notification should be also configured for test workflow :
Trigger: ambra-imaging
User Notification Preference: Imaging Available
Recipient: provider role
Why are ONE APIs completely down on stage servers? Are we tracking a bug for that?

Dylan Marks Andrew Ghafran Abbas
We investigated this problem and found out that the payload which we are sending to the notification server has no issue, its similar to that of other notifications payload. Everything seems fine at this end of code. Can you please check if
`ambra-imaging` trigger is being handled in the pubsub/push notification code for mobile?

Asad Zubair
Dylan Marks does this need to go through you to get on the mobile roadmap?

I don't think we originally had in scope the idea of triggering the ambra notification after the 'Check for Imaging' button is clicked. This notification is actually triggered based on a webhook fired from Ambra when the study actually gets transferred in for the first time.

You can see how you can re-fire that event from Ambra within the Ambra interface here:

Kevin Eckhart any reason you are tracking this specific bug?

Saqib Ahmed please focus on BW-10991 FUNCTIONAL REVIEW and BW-10984 Shipped for now and we can come back to this one.
Lauren Kokernak had mentioned this was reported by UVMMC

Lauren Kokernak is this still being tracked by UVMMC?

Typically I think of the Imaging Available notification as something that is triggered from the Ambra production server when the study originally comes in, and so having it trigger when someone manually clicks ‘Check For Imaging' is a bit different. I think it wouldn’t hurt though (eg if a nurse clicks Check for Imaging, sees the study, they don’t have to manually type into the chat box that the CT is now available).

Dylan Marks we are recommending to UVM that they keep the Ambra notifications off but they have not made a final decision on that yet. We hope to have an answer from them next week, after we meet with them.

item.title: [BW-11621] As a clinical portal user, I want to archive the 'connect' virtual room and end the connection so no other participants can continue to collaborate within this room.
item.description:
Allow clinical portal users to archive virtual rooms so that patients + other registered /non registered uses cannot access rooms after clinical user terminates them. 

  • Allow Connect users to archive a virtual room by clicking an icon/button. Please follow this design link to see the button - https://design.avizia.io/clinical-desktop/v1-stable/components/preview/25_a_3_a-open-connect.html
  • There should be a hover over explanation for this button: "Archive connection" 
  • The user that created the virtual room will see the archive button. 
  • The room should disappear from the list once it is archived. 
  • If there are active participants in the room, and the archive button is clicked, it should remove these participants from the room automatically. 
  • Once the room is archived, any participant that has the link for this room CANNOT join. They will receive the error below. 
  • If a participant tries to access the expired room link from their email or SMS or mobile app, they will receive the following error: "The virtual connection you are trying to access has expired."
item.summary: As a clinical portal user, I want to archive the 'connect' virtual room and end the connection so no other participants can continue to collaborate within this room.

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

Kevin Eckhart Aaron Harris Genevieve Stulb - Scope and design is ready for this ticket. Can be prioritized for dev.

Tuan Do
For prerequisite https://emergemd.jira.com/browse/BW-11621, we need an API call on video-api server that disconnects all the participants in a conference.

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment: Kevin Eckhart FYI

Calista Johnson / Kevin Eckhart
The ticket description states that "Language should updated based on site language selection." By site, do we mean patient portal or clinical portal ?
The email templates get sent through the clinical portal when completing the case, We do not have translation support on clinical portal sites at this time. Adding translation support on clinical portal would be a huge effort.
We could use the preferred language field on the patient record to determine which language to use for the email template. Is this ok, ?
The other pre-requisite to this ticket would be to add language support for email templates. This should be covered in BW-8149 To Do .
Asad Zubair yes using the preferred language fiedl on the patient record would work. Just to confirm would we be able to support all of the language we currently offer in the language drop down menu?

I think we should move to using content block for all the patient-specific notifications/emails. Then we have the ability to translate using the content editor language switcher, and also gives us a lot more customizability for this content for each customer.

There's a pending requirement for Northwell to customize the patient notification emails so this would address that as well.

Calista Johnson any update on this?
Calista, let me know if we want to use languageline for this.
Dylan Marks and Ajay Kumar sorry for the delay I am checking with the client.

Just wondering if you were able to reach out to the client and have any updates here. Thanks.

item.title: [BW-7522] Integration: SMART on FHIR SSO with context (Epic)
item.description:
Goal: Be able to start a video call in patient context from anywhere in Epic.

As a provider, I would like to be able to open Avizia using a SMART on FHIR link from Epic, and come in with both my user info context as well as patient/intake context.

This should be done after we complete development on BW-1640 Done . That includes the exact same logic and workflow, but uses a different standard for the SSO. We can use a lot of the same logic for this as well.

See PHX-11879 Being Analyzed for initial Allscripts development we did in PHX. This uses the Allscripts Developer portal which has a sandbox to initiate SSO calls.

Here is the developer portal App that would need to be updated.
https://apporchard.epic.com

Acceptance Criteria

  1. Implement single sign on. SMART uses OAuth with OpenID standard
    1. Also includes additional user and patient context in the SSO payload. This will require calling the FHIR APIs on Allscripts/Cerner based on the OAuth SMART authorization, and retrieving the required data.
  2. Check the user exists and upsert
    1. Use the Practitioner Resource to retrieve details on the user. Set the ExternalID based on the proper EMR configuration.
  3. Check the patient exists and upsert.
    1. FHIR only sends a PatientID. Use the OAuth token to call back to the FHIR APIs to retrieve:
      1. Patient Resource to generate Patient info (demographics).
      2. DocumentReference to retrieve a CCD document. Attach the CCD document to the patient. See BW-4983 Shipped . This will allow seeing all the patient's conditions and history. https://www.hl7.org/fhir/documentreference.html
  4. When coming in to the patient, check if the patient has an active case. Copy the logic we implemented for Athena and Epic SSO here.
    1. If active case, land the user on that case.
  5. If no active case, check if patient has appointment scheduled within an hour of current time.
    1. If appointment scheduled, create the case linked to that appointment. Do not change the status to 'Waiting Room' or Checked In'
      1. Should use exactly the same logic as Athena and Epic SSO.
  6. If an open Encounter in the EMR (EncounterID set and passed in the context link), retrieve the open encounter in the EMR and generate the case from it.
    1. Use the Encounter FHIR resource if available. Take the patient ID and call getEncounters(PatientID) - retrieve the full list of encounters for that patient. Filter through it and find the newest open/active encounter. Can get status and start time of encounter in order to find the best one.
      1. Use EMR data mapping to link proper facility, clinical module and endpoint (endpoint optional).
    2. If no active encounter found, drop the patient on the patient details page.
  7. capture a log table of click throughs from the EMR in the EMR / Log table that we are working on for Epic. This should save any context data passed in the SSO, as well as save Patient and Encounter json objects that were retrieved from the API.
item.summary: Integration: SMART on FHIR SSO with context (Epic)

comments.comment:
Asad Fareed Please add update here on your latest discussions with the Epic dev team.

Is there any way we can get a bare minimum SMART implemenation working on the Epic sandbox with a dev site? It doesn't need CCD retrieval for me to start the dialog of getting the app approved.

Epic does not provide access to practitioner.read, appointment.read and encounter.read methods with SMART in order to be able to redo the same flow as Cerner.

Epic does have a bunch of custom APIs. The responses back from SMART are not the same either.

Hi Jon,
 
Below is the ideal flow we would like to have with Epic and the SMART standard.  Right now, we are doing some of this with the Context Aware Linking approach, but I'd love to use the SMART standard instead.  We are open to using custom Epic APIs instead for the short term, but thought it would be helpful to list out the flow.  
 
1.	Provider clicks on the patient in the appointment within Epic. 
2.	SMART SSO to land in Avizia
3.	Avizia calls back to Epic and retrieves Practitioner.Read to dynamically create or update the logged in user account (provider) 
4.	Call to Epic and retrieve Patient.Read info and generates or updates patient. 
5.	Call to Epic and retrieve Appointments.Read and Encounters.Read for that patient. Looks for any open visits and grabs the CSN and department information for that visit. If there is an active appointment/encounter, we will sync that on the Avizia side so that we can start a video call in the context of that visit and maintain IDs. 
6.	Call to Epic for DocumentReference.Read to pull a CCD of the patient for context we can show in Avizia. 
7.	Call back to the Epic SetExternalConnectionStatus so we know when a provider joins the video room in Avizia. 
8.	Future: call DocumentReference.Write to attach any documentation on this visit captured in Avizia (eg images from devices, call start/end times, any documentation populated by the patient or other staff while in the video call, chat history etc). This could be a PDF or a CCD format. 
 
 
Thanks,
Dylan
 
 

Dylan Marks 
Product Integration Architect, Avizia
email/video: dylan@avizia.com  
mobile: +1 403.471.0906
 www.avizia.com 
 
 
From: Jon Tan <jtan@epic.com>
Date: Thursday, January 18, 2018 at 1:34 PM
To: "open.epic - Inquiries" <open@epic.com>, Asad Fareed <asad.fareed@tenpearls.com>
Cc: Dylan Marks <dylan@avizia.com>, Asad Zubair <asad.zubair@10Pearls.com>
Subject: RE: Smart on fhir error
 
Sure,
 
Hi Asad.  I know we had an email chain about getting a meeting together and I apologize that we weren't able to do so today - I got booked up pretty quickly.  My Friday is pretty booked up as well - do you have any availability on Monday?
 
Jon
 
 
-----Original Message-----
From: open.epic - Inquiries 
Sent: Thursday, January 18, 2018 12:56 PM
To: Asad Fareed <asad.fareed@tenpearls.com>; open.epic - Inquiries <open@epic.com>
Cc: dylan@avizia.com; asad.zubair@10pearls.com; Jon Tan <jtan@epic.com>
Subject: RE: Smart on fhir error
 
Adding Jon Tan
 
You could potentially use the ViewUser web service to get information about a user record within Epic. Jon could you take it from here for working with Muhammad on this?
 
Thanks
Richard

Hi Dylan Marks
As discussed, due to the roadblocks on this ticket, we have paused development here and are working on BW-7479 Being Analyzed instead.

item.title: [BW-3493] Sync Appointment Status changes with EHR
item.description:
As a provider, I would like to see in my EHR when the patient checks in for the appointment in Avizia.

Send Avizia Appointment status change event -> Redox -> EHR.
Round trip syncing of Appointment requires sending status event changes to the EHR when the status changes in our system.

  1. Any changes to Status sent from the EHR should trigger the change in Avizia.
    1. See workflow events in BW-4119 Shipped
  2. Add event trigger that notifies Gateway or Mirth when the status of an Appointment Changes
  3. When the patient checks in for an appointment, trigger an update to the EHR with the 'arrived' status.
    1. Ensure this also changes the status in the Avizia appt.
  4. When the case is signed in Avizia, update the appointment to 'fulfilled' in the EHR.
    1. Also change the status in the Avizia appt
  5. When the appointment is cancelled in Avizia, send the 'cancelled' status to the EHR.

See the statuses we are using on Appointment object: https://emergemd.jira.com/browse/BW-2920
proposed | pending | booked | arrived | fulfilled | cancelled | noshow | entered-in-error


https://www.lucidchart.com/invitations/accept/d21e32cd-1568-4414-adfe-362aef8653fd
item.summary: Sync Appointment Status changes with EHR

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: In Redox - Scheduling data model. Event type of 'Modification'. Andy is looking into setting this up for Athena.

Dylan Marks
Andy suggested in redox channel to use PatientAdmin data model with Event type "Arrival" for patient check-in/encounter. We are moving forward with his suggestion as we also think its an appropriate datamodel for this purpose according to its description in their docs .

We already have a subscription setup with Athena for this data model however the call is not functional at this moment. We have escalated that issue on slack channel.

Asad Zubair Kaab Ahmed

On our call with Northwell yesterday we talked through sending these appt status events into Allscripts. It's great that we have been working on this as it will really refine the provider's experience with jumping between the EMR and Avizia. I think there is some complexity here with check in requiring additional data to be configured in our Athena instance for that patient. We could manage a lot of that with ensuring we have created good test patients in athena with proper consent and insurance data populated.

Anything else I need to follow up on for this?

Less important is being able to change the start and end times, as long as we can send 'Arrival, Cancelled, Fulfilled' statuses.

Some EMRs may not like us changing start and end times but be okay sending statuses, so we should handle that gracefully if Redox passes back failure for changing start and end times.

I sent this email to Gillian:
"I have a quick question on patient appointment check in. We are looking to check the patient in on Athena when the patient checks in on Avizia.
Using something like this: https://api.athenahealth.com/preview1/1959282/appointments/<%=json.Visit.VisitNumber%>/checkin

We receive an error that says the insurance information is required before you can check in the patient. We looked in the Athena UI and populated this patient with insurance info but it is still showing an error.

Would you be able to have a look at Patient 6101 and see what other data we need to populate?"

Sounds like we don't have access to Gillian or other Athena developer resources until we get on another Athena development wave. Unless we can figure out ourselves exactly what data is missing from the patient's info in Athena to allow check in, we may have to settle for a test harness and mockup and trust that we will see this working when we actually implement this for northwell and fairview. We can open any bugs if necessary when implementing for an actual customer.

Dylan Marks

  1. Based on recent discussions, we will be taking the workflow for patient arrivals upto the point where we get the insurance error in Redox. We are assuming that this error would be fixed once we resume Athena support with the Fairview prod implementation.
  2. We have observed that we are getting "undefined" errors with the No-Show. Is the "No-Show" status in scope here ?
  3. We are in talks with Redox to get the Scheduling Modification API up and running for other appointment updates.
  4. The appointment cancel call is working.

Sounds good.
"No-show" doesn't have to be in scope. I would fail gracefully for now - if you get back an error from Redox, just log it and carry on.

The most important thing in the next couple weeks we need to get rock solid is the EMR -> Avizia appt updates. Most of the time, the EMR is going to be the source of truth and all changes will be happening via the EMR. This story talks about 'sync', which means we gracefully handle changes going back and forth, but I'd be willing to drop support for Avizia -> EMR updates for short term if we need to focus on EMR ->Avizia.

Some important tests:

  1. Cancelled appt from EMR, then a new appt with the same ExternalAppointmentID and different clinical module, assigned provider etc.
  2. Updates to appt - clinical module change, status change, assigned provider change, date/time change.
    1. Ensure we are gracefully handling appt reminder notification updates.
    2. Ensure that the patient details page doesn't have a massive list of old cancelled Appts to make it hard to read. See BW-4615 Shipped .

See the Northwell Appointment interface (Phase 1b) requirements here:
Northwell_Integrations_Requirements_Phase1B_and_Phase2_08.17.2017.pdf
EMR to Avizia works fine, however when an appointment is checked in from Avizia, update is not sent to the EMR.
What's the timeframe for getting the Appointment checkin status change back to the EMR?

Dylan Marks
This is dependent on BW-5040 Shipped due to the webhook functionality we have implemented, which in turn is dependent on BW-4868 Shipped .
We are waiting on these tickets to move to staging before we can push this to staging.
Any details why this is back in development?

Up till now, on case complete event we were sending the signed PDF back to the EMR. This functionality would be affected by BW-9150 Shipped , which is under development. This is the reason we've moved this back in development.

Dylan Marks

We have covered appointment check-in and case complete events from Avizia to EHR in their respective tickets. However we don’t have any event to send back appointment status ‘fulfilled’ or ‘cancelled’ as addressed in this ticket. Since this is quite an old ticket, should we close this one and create another Jira for these functionalities?

item.title: [BW-10778] BW - Patient's Name Disappearing after case is created
item.description:
Description
AXA has experienced an issue where a patient created a case/intake and was in the waiting room waiting to be seen. Some where along the way, the patients name disappeared from the intake. The first and last name changed to 'Case ID 480 from Web'. The patient was seen and the case was completed, but now the intake is not recorded in case history.

Patient name: Bianca Zardo
ID: 1433

Axa Case:
https://axapartners.avizia.com/#/case-detail/f877cd0b-0277-415d-8b3e-a21d14e1665b/621807b3-a19c-4dbb-839e-0035b15acd85

The only way I can replicate the 'Case ID ___ from Web' is to create a case from the All Cases page and skip the name in step 5. However, Axa does not create cases from the clinical site, patients only create cases from the patient site.

Environment
axapartners.avizia.com

* Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.
item.summary: BW - Patient's Name Disappearing after case is created

comments.comment: Dylan Marks , this is the other issue that AXA is experiencing. The patient supposedly created this intake from the patient site and was placed in the waiting room, but show how the name disappeared and changed to 'Case ID 480 from Web' appeared. Can you please look into why this would happen? Please let me know if you need more information. Thank you!

We will need dev to look at this. Ideally including some review of logs. I'm unclear how we can pull logs for an OAuth SSO.

Ziauddin any ideas on what might be happening here?

It does look like this was created based on patient intake, rather than a case created from clinical portal by skipping creating a new patient.

Hey Dylan Marks , I checked the case details extract and I see that Case 480 was created on the Clinical-portal. It was created by Hanada Shatara. Now, I mentioned to AXA that the only time I've see the name show up as 'Case ID ___ From Web' is when I skip step 5 when creating a new case from the all cases page. AXA said that they dont create cases from the All Cases page and only patients create new cases. Is it possible to see for sure where and how this case was created?

item.title: [BW-11549] Clinical Portal: Admin cannot edit SIP address in User Settings page
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

  1. Navigate to More > Settings > click a user
  2. Enter a value in the SIP Address line
  3. Click Save
  4. Go back to the same user

Issue:

  • The new SIP Address value has not been saved even though the user sees the "User Updated" modal

Expected Behavior:

  • The admin should be able to update the SIP Address just like they can update all the other fields on this page
item.summary: Clinical Portal: Admin cannot edit SIP address in User Settings page

item.title: [BW-9726] Clinical Portal: Video call issue with provider to patient call
item.description:
Steps:

  • Login to Patient portal https://one-patients-dt.avizia.com
  • Create visit
  • Login to Clinical portal https://one-sites-dt.avizia.com
  • Goto case created by patient
  • Initiate video call

Expected result:

  • Video call functionality should work as per functionality

Actual result:

  • Initiating Video call from Clinical portal:
  • On call acceptance from patient end, provider user is able to see patient's screen share instead of patient's view via webcam
item.summary: Clinical Portal: Video call issue with provider to patient call

item.title: [BW-4700] Enterprise: Disabling Pokitdok option on insurance providers tab should retain Pokitdok configuration
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

  • Login as admin user on enterprise
  • Go to Other settings-> Payment management tab
  • Go to insurance provider tab
  • Disable Pokitdok via checkbox option

Expected Result:

Pokitdok configuration should retain and all fields should be in read only mode but Pokitdok functionality should not work

Actual Result:

On disabling Pokitdok, all configuration get vanished
item.summary: Enterprise: Disabling Pokitdok option on insurance providers tab should retain Pokitdok configuration

item.title: [BW-11055] IE 11: Call is getting stuck at both ends (Patient & Provider) after few seconds
item.description:
Pre-condition:
Provider created appointment with patient
OR
Provider created a case with patient
OR
Patient created a case

Steps:

  1. Provider calls the patient
  2. Patient receives the call
  3. Both can hear and see each other

Issue:
After some time call gets stuck at both end
Both cannot hear each other and camera screen got stuck

Issue is consistent on IE
item.summary: IE 11: Call is getting stuck at both ends (Patient & Provider) after few seconds

item.title: [BW-10647] Ringing tune is keep ringing at provider end when provider is with connected call with patient
item.description:
Steps to reproduced:

  1. Login on patient portal and create case
  2. Login with provider and open the created case
  3. Provider started video call with the patient from case detail page
  4. Patient receives the call and gets connected with provider

Expected result:
Patient and provider both should be in connected call
Both can see and hear each other

Actual result:
Provider and Patient can see and hear each other
But ringing tune is keep ringing at provider end along with Patient’s voice

Provider: IE (11.431.16299)
Patient: Chrome (65) + IE (11.431.16299)
item.summary: Ringing tune is keep ringing at provider end when provider is with connected call with patient
